After all that, we still went to the bar and had two rounds while we waited.  Good selection of beer, bartenders were fast to see that we wanted booze and wasted no time in getting it.  

Then, we get our text message - our bay is ready, requiring us to go muscle into the line and tell the check in staff we are ready (which then irritates everyone in line because you are obviously butting in), but thats the way they like it here I guess.  

We head to our bay with a "bay concierge" that gives us the down low on the mechanics of play.  Its not the most intuitive thing in the world, but it works.  

We start hitting balls and our waiter shows up.  He literally walks us through the entire menu, page by page, explaining burgers, and appetizers, and frozen margaritas like we had never been to a pub before and didn't know what a "slider" was.  (Mind you, you pay by the hour at this place, so someone taking your time is quite annoying).  We order a bucket of beer and chips and guac, and shoo him off and get back to our golf.  Beers arrive, chips arrive - and our waiter arrives..... and stays.... and gets all chatty about football and where my family is from, and his Grandma in Colorado, and what it was like working after Christmas, and all sorts of topics that none of us care to talk about.  ugh, leave us alone - we are here for golf and beer, not a new pal.

When the chips came out, one in my party leaned over to the server and said, "do you know one thing thats missing in this place?"  The server leaned in all interested.... "napkins - there are no napkins on the table".  Our server launched into a story about why there are no napkins - another server spilled a huge tray of soda into a bussing cart and that knocked over someones golf bag, and on and on and on..... and no napkins.  He stopped talking and stared at us - and we asked him, "could we have napkins?" - and there was this 'oh yeah' moment - he was oblivious at times.

So, we shoo waiter off to get another bucket of beer and a refill of chips, and he comes back with the beer, and no chips (and again, all chatty - does this guy have other tables?).  The refill of chips took about 20 minutes.  We came at an odd time, and we were expected home for dinner, but the burgers and sandwiches on other tables looked very good.

The kicker though, was that near the end of our session, our new buddy server out of the blue told us that the day after Christmas, there was a five hour wait, and they ran out of food, and booze, and kegs, etc.  He told us that they were going to get a lot of negative reviews for that on an email service card that is sent to you the next day after playing.  He asked us if we wouldn't mind marking everything 5 stars because they really needed the good marks, and he would buy us desert if we said yes.  

OK, this is the business guy in me coming out now, but the whole reason for getting feedback from your customers is to IMPROVE and figure out where you are failing.  The fact that you have a 40 minute check in process, or that you ran out of beer one night, or that there are no napkins on the table, or that there seems to be tons of staff walking around but not helping the bottlenecks - these are ALL issues that management needs to be aware of - but instead, they try to bribe you so that you will rate them the way they want to be rated.  If I owned this place, I would be PISSED off.   

Again, its a really fun concept, but it will try on your nerves big time.

i just moved out here from boston 3 months ago. Michelle made me feel like I was back at home with her hospitality and wicked sweet accent. great food great atmosphere, can't wait to come back soon!!!! Brittany our server was awesome too!

My family and I come here almost twice a week and find the place very relaxing and fun. We've had many servers and different experiences, but today was definitely one of the worse. After waiting an hour, we got our bay and waited a moment for a friend to get out of the restroom (which would have been no more than 5mins) before we started our time... We were approached by a manager who told us we had to start our time RIGHT THEN and couldn't wait for our friend. The man took my credit card and attempted to add time as my friend was coming back, I don't understand why he couldn't have waited 5 minutes for our friend when they hold bays longer than that..... Very unprofessional in my opinion.... After we got all started, we waited 10 minutes to be greeted by our server who finally got us some drinks and our food order in. That was the last we saw of her until the end of our time... No drink refills, no checking up on us or anything. We had to have a sever look for her to check us out.... Turns out she was sitting at another bay chatting with friends.... Other than this experience , we've all loved top golf! Hopefully someone from top golf reads this and is able to correct these unprofessional staff members of theirs...

One of the best entertainment venues around! Just went to the VIP party and I was absolutely impressed. Arcade style golfing with great music, food, drinks, and friendly staff.... I'm hooked! 

The venue itself is impeccable, flat screen TV's everywhere you look, pool tables, football, the top deck bar, oh and let's not forget, the golf. The setup is perfect for groups, this place has something for everyone. 

The food was such high quality I thought I was eating at a 5 star restaurant. The selection of drinks was impressive to say the least, from custom cocktails to a wide variety of draft options. 

The staff was super friendly and eager to help at a moments notice. They also had great personalities, many of them danced as different songs came over the rocking sound system. Everyone seemed to love working at this place so much that my girl is considering a part time job here haha. 

The golfing itself is arcade style meaning they have various games to challenge all skill levels. Some people in our group had never golfed before and absolutely had a blast learning the basics. 

Bottom line is, thank you TopGolf for coming to Gilbert, AZ. I will see you often!
Let's Play!

We visited Top Golf last weekend to celebrate our friends birthday.  We had a party of 8.  We all had a fun time hitting the balls eating and drinking.  The service was top notch.  Very friendly and helpful staff. You don't need to know how to play, just have a good time.  Highly recommend going!

Super fun golfing. It's outside and it's a bar atmosphere. There are misters and band and it feels really good out here even on a hot summer night.  We are having tails beer and food along with brain golf game. All the golf balls of chips in them and they're automatically scored and it makes it fun even if you're not a great golfer

The food was great and the service was phenomenal. Specifically, Jill, JJ, Ashely, and Todd were professional, friendly, and easygoing bartenders. I highly recommend visiting this restaurant if you are staying at the Talking Sticks Resort or in the Scottsdale, AZ area.
Wow! Top golf on steroids. Amazing Vegas style entertainment. Not just golf. We enjoyed the bar, atmosphere, food and POOL. A must experience while in Vegas!
This was my first time here. Chelsey and Bambi and Ashley made this the most amazing time. I will be back and will bring my friends for happy hour and some golf!!

This is an update review of TopGolf.  I was a frequent visitor here.  However the last visit I was there I got food poisoning from a sunrise burger.   I ran into a server that knew me by name and asked why I wasn't going anymore which I explained why and her response was yeah I wouldn't trust the kitchen.  I think I will stick to normal driving ranges for now on.
One of my favorite places in the whole city. And absolutely amazing place with great drinks and great food. And im not even a golfer!

Careful of the timeline they give you. We were told 45 mins and ended up waiting for way way longer. Seems like it's part of their strategy to have everyone wait in the restaurant/bar area as it ends up generating $$.

Are you kidding me?  This place is so cool...Kinda like half bar..half driving range.
It makes it really fun for people who are good drinkers..(me) and bad golfers..(me)
So much fun...I cant wait to go back.

Yesterday Saturday August 13, we visited top golf for a family night. Kaylynn was our server and gave great customer service. She had a lot of tables to handle and did it all with a smile on her face. We had a great time talking to her and hearing how her night was going. She did everything she could to make sure we had a good experience and we all appreciated that very much. She definitely deserves props and all the tips.

Had a great time. Great service.  Too bad its in Snobdale I mean Scottsdale.  Some 60+ old man killed it for me while he was attempting to hit on me in front of his wife and my husband and son. Can't wait for the Gilbert location to open (where we live) to get away from the Scottsdale vide!!!

Becoming a Platinum Member at Topgolf Scottsdale is one of the best decisions I have made for my business.  I have the opportunity to have a bay as part of my Platinum Membership at no additional cost.  I have 3-8 meetings a week here which all my clients thinks is great.  The staff here is the best.  Super responsive and willing to help in any way possible.  I would recommend it to anyone who is looking to not only have an amazing "office" but who would like to increase your business in a very fun way.
Golf games are fun, people are friendly, just not happy that the "chef" doesn't know what Tuscan kale is when selling a kale salad. More of a nacho place

Last night I met some girlfriends at top golf for happy hour. First we had to find someone in the bar to clean the table we wanted to sit at. Then after sitting at that table for over 20 minutes someone finally came over to take a drink order. Mind you the bar was less than half full. After that another 20 minutes went by for them to come and take a food order then we waited another 20 minutes to 30 minutes for our food to arrive and mine was wrong. The atmosphere was good but the service in the bar needs a lot of work.  I was a little disappointed to say the least. I had heard great things about it and was excited to try it.

I came here for the first time a couple weeks ago place was pack. Place is pretty big and busy. Had an awesome time even though I'm not a golfer. The top level views were amazing. Amazing place! Highly recommend checking it out. Super Fun!

First time at Top Golf and we had a great time!  Staff was friendly and helpful.   Our server was helpful in getting the system up and running.  I thought the cost it was good value.  They provide clubs but you can also bring your own.  However I think you can only use your irons.  Check their website to be certain.  Had lots of fun.
Topgolf was a great experience with my friends. Our bay host Charlie was great and so was the hospitality shift lead Michelle. Best experience I've had here by far!!

So cool. Cool place to hang out. Not too fancy. You can wear casual clothes. Servers bring food and drinks right to your table while you're "golfing." It's really easy. I've never played golf before and even I had a good time playing. Food is even good for what you would think is more of a bar. Relaxed, chill environment. Love it!

I love TopGolf, really fun place to go for a date night or when you want to go out with some friends. Food and drinks are really good but kind of pricey for my range but not too bad overall. Definitely going to be going back!

Super fun place to hang out, my husband loves coming here and the service is always really good.  The place is always kept nice and clean and they play good music! 

They have a good selection of beer and food. The deep fried pickles are so good and crispy! They also come in a cute little basket.

I know this seems stupid but I don't understand why they don't have toilet seat covers in any of their bathrooms, for the amount of people that come here you would think they would have them. But other than that!
We love top golf!!

I have been to TGLV a few times now and I am really impressed. .  My motivation was different than most.  I was looking for a Callaway fitting location and found TGLV. Impressive facility with great people.  This place makes golf fun for anyone with any skill level.  Food was great and beer was cold.  I didn't go during prime time but this looks like the place to be on a weekend night.  I want to specially compliment their Director of Instruction Sean Solodovnick  If your serious about improving your game I high recommend seeing Sean. Huge improvement for me.

Junior golfers look elsewhere.  

The front desk and "Concierge" (and I put those in BIG quotes) and check in staff is like a bunch of teenagers at the mall.  They are just there to take up space and annoying you.   Inconsistencies were everywhere. We are told that no one can bring drivers. OK.  I'm fine with that.  But I see about 5 bays with hackers swinging their drivers.  I inquire about the obvious inconsistency with 2 different staff members and their response was "oh I'm sure the manager will tell them to stop.  There's nothing we can really do about that."  

But they insist I walk my clubs back to the car and stow my hybrids.  REALLY?  My son who is 4 wanted to use his driver so he hit a whopping 30 yards.  Nope she said everyone is held to the same standards.  OK robot...but did you just tell me there's NOTHING you can do about those guys using their drivers???  

Dont' claim to be junior friendly when it's the complete opposite.  Golf is a dying sport as it is...let's find a new way to make it even less appealing for them.  The definitely should revisit their junior policy to something that makes common sense.  Anyone under 10 can use their driver doesn't seem that out of the world to me.  And adhere to the rule you "impose".   I saw at least 3 other kids with their drivers and no one telling them to put it away.  When we finally got to our bay, the "concierge" guys said "I woulda let your little guy use his driver...the rule is totally stupid."  And so I'm thinking...oh so the rule is dependent on who sees you walk into the door.  Take my advice...sneak in your drivers all you want.  I should have.  

The waitress service was nice and prompt.  Food was better than expected.  Facility in top condition.  Too bad junior robots run the front.

Perfect place to go and have a few drinks with friends! I go here almost every weekend  I was usually never disappointed until One weekend there was an off duty employee who was cursing loud. Loud enough for everyone around to hear.

I'll start with TopGolf is a fun place to hang out. The facility itself is well put together from the furniture, lounge, bars, view, etc. There's no doubt that this is overall a very cool place. However, I am unimpressed with the staff/service. Being a local I am very understanding of service in vegas - good and bad. I am easy going when service is bad, but also extremely appreciative when service is good. I will say that I am very critical on service because I have worked behind and in front of the bar as well as managed restaurants and other departments. 
With all that being said, me and my girlfriend were excited to check out TopGolf since we've never been. When we arrived we were hungry so we decided to check everything out to get our bearings, eat, and then play. We were approached by a women (who I didn't catch her name) she was very helpful and started to explain where everything was until we were interrupted by a gentleman who said that he would take us up. He introduced himself (keone) and asked us if we worked at SLS, and confused we said, no, and kept walking. I questioned where we we're going and what we were doing. I wasn't sure if he thought we were someone else or if he was just showing us the facility. I was kind of ignored and we kept walking. He sat us at a bay and then came back with three other girls to join our group... which us or the other girls were not expecting. We were all very confused because at some point he thought we asked for bay 302. Which was completely wrong we never said a word about meeting any one or had said the number 302 because we didn't even know that it existed. Keone literally came out of no where and told us to follow him. To make matters worse, he tried to put us at his friend's bay who was an older gentleman that was there by himself next to where he sat us to make up for the confusion. He said that it was okay and we can order whatever we want. It was just really uncomfortable and awkward. I'm pretty sure that he was a manager which made it weirder. We both were being very nice and took a couple swings thanked them for their time, but we really just wanted to go get some lunch.
We went to the nearest bar and was greeted by bartender, Agnes. We were the only two at the bar, and then shortly after 3 other gentlemen came and sat for some drinks. I ordered the strawberry jalapeno margartia. Since I have bartended I like to watch how my drinks are made, and it was very apparent that Agnes was an inexperienced bartender. Which, to her defense, she may have been trained to make her cocktails a specific way, but she really just exuded lack of confidence behind the bar. She built the cocktail with ingredients, dropped some cut up strawberries, rolled the drink a few times, and poured it over ice. The strawberries weren't muddled, and the cocktail wasn't shaken with any ice. Again, she may have been trained that way, but the cocktail was so mediocre and aesthetically unappealing. It just seemed lazy to me. Agnes lacked personality, she barely spoke, wasn't very attentive, and didn't really smile. We ordered our food. I asked for no onions on my burger.... got onions. I ended up picking it off myself. It's just annoying because it was slow and she only had 5 people sitting at her bar and we were the only 2 eating which means that it was a careless mistake. If it was a full bar and you're getting your butt kicked I can understand forgetting to type in "no onions". The food was extremely delicious, and they have great options on their menu!
So, I'd say the first hour of being there was just so awkward and annoying just from the staff/service alone. We finally get checked in and are waiting to be walked to our bay. The girl at the check in didn't have much personality either she lacked confidence as well. Everything seemed a bit unorganized. We get walked to our bay, and I wish I remembered her name, we finally had someone with personality that was cracking some jokes, and made me laugh. We finally played some TopGolf and was having a good time. We went when it was 108 degrees outside @4pm. I assumed that there would be AC which it looks like it was set up, but it wasn't on/working. 

The game itself was a lot of fun. A bit pricey, but I didn't mind spending the money. The staff seems inexperienced/lost, and it shows that there wasn't a lot of fundamental training done or guidance from management. The employees just seem really socially awkward/goofy which is okay, but there has to be some level of professionalism. Hopefully they tie up loose ends with staff so that everything is seamless from check in - ordering - check out and farewell.

Well horrible first visit. ...xoxo don't get a waiter to save our life. Finally grab someone to some, nothing then grab someone else just to be told it's not my table.  Then order drinks, they a are the wrong ones and then takes another 20 minutes to get the right ones. Talked to manager and all taken care of.
Nice place to hang out with friends and have few drinks. The golfing experience here is comparable with bowling.

Fun place for a party. 
Don't eat any of the uncooked food like lettuce, cold slaw, .... !!! Food handling is a big issue.

Can't use your own hybrids, woods or Driver, which is weird since you can hit the woods and driver they provide. Not really a driving range to work on your golf game. ts more so a bar where you can hit golf balls.

We have had a lot of fun here with friends.  This place is huge and waiting to get a bay is typically at a minimum.  Not too pricey if you have a few people chip in.  Drinks are kind of expensive at the bar.  Fun place to spend a few hours or an evening.

I took my two sons here and we all had the best time.  They loved it but they were upset because I beat them in golf....lol.  They were trying to hit the ball to hard.  My game was to hit the ball closer to the holes... I then got more points.  BIG HINT....

Great facility, horrible service. We had a bd party for kids, 20 guests (kids and adults) and one server. It took our server 1 hour to bring "unlimited" drinks, one hour to find a cork screw to open wine, the monitor never synced up the names....

Coming from San Diego for the weekend came in on a Saturday. The wait was 45 minutes to an hour which was all good figured we would just grab some drinks while we wait. Upon ordering a drink at the bar was told vertical (VALID) driver licenses of legal drinking age are not accepted by top golf policy. When we asked the bartender the specifics she was  extremely not polite and couldn't explain the reasoning although she confirmed the drivers license was valid and the member of our party was infact 22. Following when ordering a pitcher of beer we were "helped" by another extremely not polite bartender. We were excited to take our friends here but really disappointed by the service and the employees. Probably won't be back.

I love top golf. You can literally have never swung a Golf Club in your life and still enjoy your time here. The environment is always full of energy, and I've noticed that they periodically do themed events with staff. In my opinion, the cost of the individual bay is beyond reasonable, especially split up amongst a group. The drinks and food can add up though, which is probably to be expected. The music is always great. I haven't tried them yet, but I know they have other activities available, like Wii, pool tables, and a few others I cant recall. Definitely a good time, whether for a work outing, birthday event or even a nice first date!

Went on a packed Sunday but surprisingly did not have to wait long. Staff were knowledgeable, friendly, and organized. We brought our kids who had a ton of fun. We ordered snacks and drinks and they were good. Going at sunset makes for a great view and you get to experience the fairway lights at night.

This a fun activity if you have the spare cash to spend, as this place is on the more pricey side. Be prepared to get decent food that might seem a little over priced. If you plan on drinking be ready to get your wallet out. Plan on inviting multiple people to join you, I suggest gathering out in front of the front doors, as the lobby area tends to be very loud and cramped. Also, send your people the instructions on what to expect when they arrive as the process of checking in takes more than 10 minutes and involves two different counters in the lobby.

Worst customer service ever. I am in Phoenix on vacation. Cool place to golf, too bad the interactions with staff aren't up to the challenge. We were given a twenty minute wait time. They said they would text when our turn was up. Thirty minutes later-no text. We went and checked and they said  they text five times. We showed them our phone with no texts.  And the dude said "oh yea, well, sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't." No sorry, no embarrassment. They did not care. That was one example I have others that I won't put here. Customer service is dead! I should stop caring.

overall a great experience. a little over staffed.  I think the scoring system may have miscalculated a little. you can pick different games to play. we went as a party of 4 in a bay and was perfect! I wish I didn't have to give my cc info so many different times. I had to give it initially and then to open tab and then to extend the game. Two hours is perfect! Food was okay. we had chips and salsa, buffalo chicken egg rolls, and chili cheese fries. the bartender did try to give us another tables beers. The staff was okay, very awkward with some of the staff just standing around, it made it uncomfortable to approach about being a first timer.

Very very fun. Food and drink prices were no where near as expensive as some casino restaurants and clubs/bars. Very friendly and attentive staff. They have a pool, good for private parties. Very cool GPS technology with golf balls. Lots of bar, lots of places to sit and mingle, there was even a live band. Love this place.

If you are serious about golf and care about the competition I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you have your own clubs. The default selection they have is a joke and for someone that uses steel clubs you're screwed if you've never hit graphite clubs. 

Other than that the atmosphere is great and it's fun to drink and hit balls but don't count on playing competitively unless you have your own clubs.

For non-golfer this is really fun! We had the top floor I would recommend this level. I waited rylan was friendly and awesome! The food is ok but they have a full bar which makes up for it ! This place is a lot of fun!

I like this place, and would like it more if I could go there more often. I know it's popular, but it's always PACKED, often with 20 somethings. It's a great idea for a fun night out, but go early if you don't want to wait hours!

I went to topgolf with some friends from out of town. They have a 6 year old girl and were only in town for a few days so I decided to take them here because I had heard good things. All of the praise was well deserved. The service was great and he golf game accommodated all levels of golfing prowess. From the 6 year old who had never swung a golf club to my brother that has played for years. I would recommend it to anyone as a good place to get some drinks and have some fun. Like others have said, as far as activity type, it's much closer to bowling than golf.

It's like a bowling alley for golf!  Beautiful outdoor patio, family friendly, reasonable priced food and broad menu choice  The service was fantastic and the self injectible donuts are simply delicious (sounds crazy, I know)

Came here on Sunday for my younger brothers birthday. Waited about an hour for 2 bays but we hung out in the restaurant and drank. None of us golf at all but we had a great time! Can't wait to go back and check it out again.

This place is fantastic! The food is awesome and so is the staff. They're always so energetic and excited for their guests. They are also a very charitable organization and actively donate to many charities and help those in need.
Had a blast. Came on a Saturday night, host said 2 hour wait. We only waited an hour. Management very attentive and friendly. Will be back again.

I had a great time playing golf with my girlfriend on Valentine's Day. Our server came over letting us know that he would be dropping by every now and then if we had any questions. I wanna point out that he never once came by again, I went to the bar to order and appetizer, they told me it would be put in 10 minutes. Went back a half an hour later to get told that the kitchen is now closed. I was pretty understanding, so I went ahead and asked for a beer instead. "Bar closes at 11:30." This is what I get in response, once again I'm understanding coming from customer service. Then I check my phone to see if my girlfriend had asked for anything and it was 11:20. So not only did the incompetent piece of Shit not get me my appetizer, the bar tender wouldnt take 10 seconds to pour me a beer. To top the entire night off, I was told I would pay 45 dollars and I could play till close. Ended up getting charged 90$, didn't get an appetizer I had ordered, couldn't get a beer cuz the bar closed in 2 minutes. Overall I will not be returning to this location, the customer service here is an absolute joke. If you want your money's worth, head to Gilbert. Unless all you wanna do is smack some golf balls.
Our server, DeShaswn, was great. He's attentive, energetic, & fun. Our food & drinks were good too. We're definitely coming back to Top Golf.

I was skeptical of this place going in, but I must admit I was genuinely surprised. The food was great, I took a dip in the pool and enjoyed the drinks as I watched all my friends whack some balls. The night I went they had a live band which was nice compared to yet another Vegas "club mix". Next time I'm in Vegas... I'll go back and bring a few more friends!

Our party arrived at 11:15 am today, when the price is $25. The place was packed. We waited in line to become life time members at $5 each (membership is required), then waited in another line at the concierge's desk. We were told it would be 45 minutes to get to our spot. Since we would not be able to begin our fun, it would be after the 12:00 cut off for the price increase from $25 to $35. Whatever. So we decide to wait in the game and TV room. The waiter, Dan, came and took our drink orders. He brought them about 10 minutes later and we ordered appetizers and one of us ordered ice cream. Plus, 3 waters were ordered. Nothing ever came. About 35 minutes later we asked Dan where everything was. He said he'd check, and we also asked for the water. Another 20 or so minutes went by, and our group was called to report to our spot. Suddenly, Dan was there!! He wanted to make sure we got our food and said it would be delivered to us. At this point none of us even cared about our food. Within minutes, the food appeared, like magic!! I asked him again, for the 3rd time, for water. About 10 minutes later, the water arrived, along with 2 beers which had been ordered. So to sum up, when you get there, bring your own food and drink because by the time you get it it will be time to leave. I did see a sign in the ladies room they are having a hiring event on March 22. Maybe they don't have enough employees right now. I'm certain they don't have enough cooks, and they definitely had poor customer service today! Anyway, the golf part was fun but we were on the very bottom floor. One of the people I was with said it's more fun to be on the floors above. You'd certainly get a better view. I liked the TVs since it was the first day of March Madness. This location is crazy busy. I have heard the Gilbert location is not as busy. I doubt I will go back to this location. I think i will just go to a driving range at a local golf course and hit balls. I don't need all the glamour and Scottsdale fanciness this place has.

Topgolf is a hole in one!

Opening weekend...who knows what we're walking into.

-Parked the car (parking might be quite difficult depending on day and time you're here)(There is also valet)
-Waited in line to get a membership for $5 (45 minutes in the sun)
-Waited in line to get a bay (Saturday evening...opening weekend)(20 minutes)
-Escorted to our bay and given some instructions and advice (friendly and helpful)
-Started whacking away as our server came and introduced himself
-Ordered drinks...kept whacking
-Extended our time to order more drinks and continue the whacking
-Paid and left

What a great night! Sure...there will be kinks to work out of such a sizable and busy place. The place is an affordable date night, a fun place to come with friends or an interesting place to do some team building.

The golf range and games are incredibly fun. Even a novice will appreciate the simplicity of arriving with just themselves, finding clubs labeled to help them out, and games that are easy to understand. That horrible "sorta" swing will get better...I promise! You may have your neighbors trying to be friendly helpers though.

The service was as expected. They are busy. If you're the type of person that can't evaluate situational probabilities...don't write a review about how slow things are. If you didn't expect things to be a bit slower based on the parking lot and lines...maybe your expectations of divine intervention on the service is the problem.

There is music, television and wi-fi. There's a live DJ on the roof and it's essentially a night club later in the night. Be warned however, this place is loud at night! If you're looking to discuss business here...you might want to find somewhere a bit quieter.

My advice to Topgolf: More craft beer on tap...and a broader selection.

Topgolf is top notch!


Try: Coming here for date night

Avoid: Bringing the kids in the evening
It's nice they have food but I would say it's more about having a couple drinks and driving a few balls. It is a fun alternative to eating out!

I decided to celebrate my son's bday on a Friday evening, so I go to topgolf that day at noon to get information about the wait time, whats the best thing to do and so forth.  So they suggest for me to call before I take my party to topgolf to have a better idea of the wait time.  I call around 6pm and I was told that there was no wait time and that if I get there now, I will be given a booth up on the 3rd level (which I had asked about earlier in the day).  So my party and I get there at 7pm (which I understand that we were going to have a wait because it was an hour later).. once we get there they inform us that it will be an 1 hr to 1 1/2 hr wait time.  So we decided to go eat dinner somewhere close by.  We get back to topgolf around 8pm, we check in and they tell us it will be a 30-45 min wait time.  We said okay we'll hang out upstairs 3rd floor where the DJ area is at.  ONce we got up there, we notice a couple of booths opened and notice a family was escorted to a booth.  We ask them how long their wait was and they said 10 MINUTES!!!!.  however they said because they have a premium/platinum membership, which we understand that they pay $$$$$ for that.  So we said okay, whatever.  My husband goes downstairs to check on our wait time and they said that there are 10 guest in front of us so it will be another HOUR or so.  It was already 9:30pm.  We didn't get a booth until almost 10:30pm and the only reason was because my husband went almost 4 times to guest services and told them, to be honest with him and tell him if we are going to get seated or we just leave.  They give you the runaround about the wait time!!! I had to wait almost 3 HOURS on Friday evening.  I felt that we were given the worst booth because of our complaint.  WE were put on the booth next to wall!!
I didn't have a great experience here, I feel like the entertainment they have is great. The golfing is nice but it could have better service. The food is great and it has an awesome ambiance.

Love this place! The food is great and there's such a variety of cocktails! The emery is so positive and it's a great outing for all ages. Hands down one of my favorite places in charlotte. They cover all bases!
One of our favorite places to go...hit some balls, get a little competition going and have some good food and great drinks!!  always fun!!!

It was my first time and we went with my family and a friend. We got the middle section on the middle row was an awesome experience. We went on Valentine's Day too and was less busy then I thought. The service was great and then didn't mind us ordering lots of fries! They were also able to get me left handed clubs since a few other golf places dont acquire it. Coming back for sure!

Another great visit, what a great venue!!! We had a blast playing for a few hours getting drinks and food. All was great. Only thing I noticed is that the golf balls hit very dead. They are probably getting old and have been hit a lot?? Did. It really matter though, we had a great time!! Put one in the Seattle area!!!!

DO NOT GO HERE if you expect good food, good service, an accurate golf machine, drinks, food or your bill that come to you in a timely matter.  This place is a total joke.  NO ONE knows what they are doing there.  The people around us got food that was ours and then we had to wait another 1/2 hour to get our food which was cold and disgusting. You will be sorry you spent a penny here.

Food took forever and it was dead..I thought the kids who worked here were rude, Loud and had 0 manners... but my server was okay the kid serving my food was nice and then my (okay) margarita sank in as soon as Kanye West played so now I'm over it and that saved  the experience. Ps. GO TO THE SCOTTSDALE ONE.

This place is awesome. Everyone was super friendly and the games are way fun. A tip: go early in the day and with a group of friends. It's not nearly as busy and when you split it up it's very affordable. Still no drivers allowed but that's okay. The range is only about 215 yards long so hitting the targets doesn't need a lot of power. I can't wait to go back!

The actual golf was fun, that part I enjoyed.  The problem I had was with the service in the bar.  Two friends and myself decided to eat lunch inside before heading to the bay to golf.  We promptly placed our order at that's where everything went downhill....

-after 30 min I had to flag someone down to bring us our waters and drinks
-after 60 min our food showed up w no silverware or napkins.  We asked for some, and received 1 set....yes, we had to then ask for two more sets.
-we then asked to speak w a manager, who asked what we wanted, let us explain what happened, asked ZERO follow-up questions, said "thank you for the feedback", and walked away.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!!!!!!!  Nothing, no empathy, no apology, no interest in digging in to what happened.  "Thank you for the feedback".  

Like I said, I enjoyed the golf experience, but would never step in that bar again.. Great Customer service is a culture you foster,  and if the mgrs. don't understand it,  why would the servers?

The good news is we only had to wait 90 minutes this time instead of three hours. Very nice facility very well-maintained. The negative is the organization from a management standpoint seems very disorganized. We had a gift card to use and not only do they not work at the lane terminal but we had to ask 3 separate employees and stand in two separate lines before someone could help us use our gift card to pay. The probably would not of been nearly as frustrating and not just waited 90 minutes.

I gave 5 stars based on observation because we didn't have time to stay to play.  Each area is set up like a living room with cozy furniture, nice size TV and the people looked like they were having fun.  The drinks/food looked yummy and the people were definitely having fun regardless of their level/score/handicap.

The golfing is obviously the best part of this place.  The staff is friendly but why are there so many of them? They are like wolves when you walk in the door. There was literally 30 employees standing around talking,  so that's where your money is going.  It's basically 60 dollars an hour for a glorified driving range.  It also should not cost money to get a plastic card with your info on it. 

This place is fun but it will nickel and dime you for every cent you have.  I would not be coming here at all if I was a local.

I expected to pay $200 min in food and beverage but did not expect the exit interview with our server. She went over the bill then said the 7% service charge was not for her it was for the people on the back.  Then she wrote a $73 on the side of our bill and said this would be your tip.  Which would've been 30% on top of the 7% service charge.  I left $43 but was a little put off by this. Our servers name  was Jhoine D

Besides this we had a good time and the food was awesome!!

Concept is awesome, basically a bowling alley version of a driving range. Setup and atmosphere are definite bright spots. Prices are tough to swallow - $60/hr after noon for 1st and 2nd levels, $75/hr for levels above 2nd. If you go w/ one other person, you end up probably hitting 50-55 balls each if you're both efficient. That kind of value is egregious. Plus they charge each person $5 for a membership card that is utterly useless. Absolutely zero user benefits w/ a membership card. 

We didn't order any food, but drink prices are decent. $28 for a beer pitcher which is respectable for Vegas. Only problem I had w/ that was I ordered a pitcher of Lagunitas and received Blue Moon or Shock Top instead. After questioning the beer, our server tasted it and gave us a sample of the "Lagunitas," which was basically Blue Moon and kept insisting that it was an IPA. Appreciate the attempt at service, but they have problems distinguishing drinks. An IPA is very different from a light Belgian ale and you can even tell by the coloration. Other than that debacle, the Frozen Mule is pretty tasty. 

Overall, the environment can be a lot of fun, especially for larger groups like bachelor parties. But as stated before, the value is just atrocious. Ended up paying $70 for an hour after waiting 40 min for a bay.

Nice place, clean, good food, fun time, Can get a little expensive in smaller groups, so i would recommend party of four or more.  Can't bring in or use driver, wedges or hybrids, because the free way is to close.  Service was very good, servers are nice and always checking back to make sure you don't need anything.  Would prefer a standard driving range, but a good fill in to keep up your swing.

Brilliant! Food excellent, even had the chef visit the table when they found out we had allergies and was so accommodating. Service top notch! Great experience. Only thing is check to see if there's a band on as its abit off putting as its so loud, they were great band but ruined banter we were having as so loud. So maybe even golf on a different floor.

I love top golf the staff is always friendly and helpful the facility is always sparkly clean and it's a great way to spend a few hours outside without getting sizzled in the sun!!! I would def recommend this to any skill level golfer they also have a pool and games so it's great even if you come just to hang out and have a few drinks or lounge by the pool!

I have a love hate relationship with this place. Somehow they built it wrong and you can't bring or use woods or hybrids for balls will go over the fence. They would not let my 5 yr old bring hers- if she can hit it that hard I should check her on the pro tour. Then they have this crazy checkin system with 2 lines and you have to remember to bring your card from last time. Very antiquated. Second line for a bay. Strange
But once you are playing it is really cool - bar and wait service, decent prices and good food. Just not the place to actually practice your game. Only for social hour. The price is the same regardless how many players so good for a group. Expensive solo. Very loud

I cant understand why people even write negative reviews about this place. Yes, the wait is long but that is why you plan accordingly. Yes, the food is nothing special but it's still worth buying. 

Even if you don't don't golf, this is a fun activity. Not for serious golfers, however. This is a great change of pace from standing around a bar or club. After your done with your play time, they have an awesome game room to continue the drunken shenanigans. 

I never pass up a chance to go here. It is too much fun!

My first time here my boyfriend and I went to get a players card and after we bought that the lady checking us out didn't give any directions on what to do or where to go, like I said it was our first time there, so we had no idea what we were doing. Finally someone told us we had to go to the concierge to get a bay, so we did that it was a 45 minute wait, no big deal so we went to order some food while we waited, it took about 10 minutes for someone to ask us if we needed anything and then 10 more minutes for our drinks to come out, and then 15 more minutes for out waiter to ask us if we wanted anything else. Meanwhile our bay was ready but our food was not so we were told we had 15 minutes to go back for a bay... This place is cool but needs some work on customer service for sure. I've been here twice now and the waiters have been the same both times, they just disappear and go off and talk to other waiters instead of asking if you would anything else.

We had recently been to top golf in Tampa and had a blast. Service and accommodations were comfy there, with soft couches and large scoreboards. When we tried the Charlotte location we were disappointed. Loud music was playing which meant it was difficult to talk. Instead of relaxing couches there were high top tables and chairs. And the scoring screens were small, overshadowed by tv channels playing above. Still a fun time but a bit more cheesy and "in your face" kind of atmosphere.
This is an awesome concept. Got in right away and had great service. Wish there were more of these places around. Would definitely recommend it to everyone!

This place is AMAZING! We came with a large group (18 and all couples) and worked a deal to have 2 side by side bays and two cabanas by the pool for 2 hours. Our server was Raquel and she was on top of her game with such a large group. We always had food and drinks in our hands. The guys and gals had fun hitting balls but my favorite part was the pool! So much fun to watch our friends play golf while relaxing in the pool, we stayed an extra hour bc we had so much fun. There was a gigantic tv so I cook also watch the olympics. AND the building overlooks Wet Republic so we got to creep on Calvin Harris as well. Win win!   Totally a well spent afternoon and I would do it again on our next trip.

Topgolf is super unaccommodating. I'm trying to reserve bays for a graduation get together and I have gotten different responses from each person I have talked to. If you have a group larger than 8 it's not worth your time to try and work with them on reservations.

Came here last Saturday with a group of 8 people. Always wanted to come here since it opened and finally got to check it out with my girlfriend and her cousins that were visiting for the weekend. 

I knew it was a nice place but it was more than I expected. I wouldn't say that it's just a fancy driving range. But it's more of a all out entertainment center. With bars, tvs, and even a pool inside. 

We arrived around 10 PM on Saturday night, there was plenty of parking, we were headed up the stairs to the entrance and a guy told us it was a 2 almost 3 hour wait. We were a little shocked at first, it was a Saturday night and we expected it to be busy but not that busy. We decided to stay and wait anyways. 

While we were waiting we hung out and played some corn ball and had some drinks. My sister in law had some wings and fries which looked good. They have a full food menu and from the looks of it, it looks good although I didn't order anything. The drinks were good and about your average price for a drink in Vegas. Aka expensive and not strong enough. We only ended up waiting for about 40 minutes before they texted us that our bay was ready. Not a long wait at all and we were already enjoying ourselves so that's a plus. 

Now the real part of the review, the golfing experience. It was everyone's first time here so the manager or the supervisor or who ever he was talked to us about how to play and work the score monitor and what not. I'm a lefty so they had to bring out my own set of left handed clubs. The orthodox clubs are already placed there in the bay. 
Everyone took turns swinging and had a good time. I've played at driving ranges before and I like how at this range it's very easy to see the flight of your ball. The real only con I have is the technical problems. At least 3 or 4 times our screen/scoreboard froze or glitched out. And we had to call someone to come over to reset it. They ended up giving us a extra 20 minutes for the technical difficulties. 

The total was a little over 200. Split 8 ways. It's decently priced for the experience and will be looking forward to our next night out here.

Held an event here for 70 clients and vendors, everything was done RIGHT! I showed up 30 minutes early, could of been 5 minutes early as everything was setup as described. Food was great, did a small breakfast for all basic pastries and fruit then did a fajita lunch that had a bunch of us going back for seconds I think there was even some third trips for some. Everyone had a great time golfers and non golfers alike. Thanks to all the team for helping us produce a great event on short notice, Heather, Bri and your crew did an outstanding job, so all that's really left is another Thank You! Lastly Chef Jake great food thanks for producing not your average golf outing fair type of food. TopGolf exceeded our expectations!

My only real problem with this establishment thus far is they over serve ppl. I have seen several men and ladies stumble out, one ending up with a broken nose!! Inexperienced bartenders not only need retraining on proper pours but a refresher course in basic cocktails. 

I love that they have Valet as it is too hot to spend forever searching for a parking space, with membership it is complimentary, just dont forget to tip! This one guy, John, he runs so fast to get my car I cant help but enjoy the view!! 

Tasty food, a bit on the slow side but those kinks will work themself out in no time.

Do not waste your time coming here. You are required to sign up for a card and pay for it. The line takes at least an hour and that's only the first step. Save your money and time and go to a regular driving range

Brought a group of 8 people to top golf tonight for the "zombie ball." Showed up at 10:30 dressed to the tee. We were cut off before we got to the bar because someone said "I'm stone sober right now." The only thing worse than the price of golf balls is the management of this establishment. I've never felt more disrespected. I will never be back and will discourage all of my friends from going.
Had a blast here! First time here. Love the atmosphere. Staff was nice and friendly and the people playing are fun as well....

My husband and I went on a Saturday morning and only had to wait a minute or two for a bay to open up. It's pretty reasonable if you go with friends and split the cost ($25 for two hours of entertainment - that's what you'd pay to go to the movies as a couple).

The food is a total rip-off though. We ordered nachos and there were literally 8 chips on the plate. EIGHT! "Wait, who hasn't eaten their second nacho yet?" is a thing I actually said.

If I could do less stars I would, horrible service, shitty atmosphere and they don't have their crap together. After being told a 45 minute wait, 2 hours pass and they say we are next ok no biggie, then another 30 minutes go by and we are now 3rd in line. This place is a joke and I recommend spending your money any where but here!!! Bad customer service and a blight on Vegas! They don't care about locals or repeats just drunk partiers!

Been to the Scottsdale Topgolf twice - once with the guys, once with a big group of family in town over Thanksgiving holiday - and had a total blast each time! What a brilliant concept - turning a driving range into a full entertainment, food and drinks venue.

It's a little pricey, but not terribly. First time I went was on a Thursday night and the place was totally packed. There are 3 levels of bays and the top (3rd) always seems to be occupied by a large corporate group - which this place is ideal for. We waited awhile, had some drinks & food, then got a bay on level 2 (the higher up you are, the better).

Golfers or non-golfers will both have fun as they've created scoring games with multiple targets, and many levels of them. Bring your own clubs or use the house clubs, it's your preference. Even if you've never picked up a club, you'll have a ton of fun at this place.
This place is amazing  I've played at other top golfs before and this one is the best ,service is great and place is nice and clean  ,the host Teegan was amazing

NOT A PLACE FOR KIDS! It seems the success has gotten to the folks at Top Golf. It started with a bad attitude at the sign in.  No friendly comments...just give me your name and wait.  Then they forced my 9 year old to put his driver and hybrid club back in the car...Sorry folks but he is 9 and can't hit the ball over your fence.  With only 2 other clubs in his bag we were unable to play.  Seriously, a 9 year old needs to avoid hitting his driver just in case he launches one over the fence.  This is common sense calling...is anyone home at Top Golf.
Was all good until server told us how we "unfortunately had to chuck all excess balls off bay." I guess $45 doesn't justify a little tweak to the system in which balls are dispensed.

Make sure you do not book your golf time online unless you want to pay an extra $25-$50 just for the reservation. This does not include your golf time.  Also be ready to pay an additional $5 per person to get a required registration card.  Read the fine print!  The management would not refund even though we explained we did not make a reservation.

Hopefully I experienced opening jitters..!!
The staff is ill prepared and ill trained to handle the volume of patrons they currently have. Customer service is not good at this time. 
30 minute wait on Thursday afternoon. Got to golf bay and computer didn't work. Took 15-20 minutes for the "guest services" person to be found and show up. 10 minutes later he was frustrated but got it going and comped us an extra hour. 40 minutes in, the entire establishment blacked out and our computer locked up again. Don't forget your waiter is just that..a waiter..they are not educated in the ways of anything but bringing food. But she did try and find the "guest services" person who eventually showed up after my brother raised cane..!!  After he showed up..it took this guy 10-15 minutes to reset the computer then he realized the bay had been rented for a corporate outing and made us move..!!! but he also comped us another hour and an appetizer for the problems. So we moved. Card still has 2 hours of play time on it but we decided to leave after playing only 1 hour. Leaving 1 hour of play time on the card. No where on the computer is there a place to click to save unused time..!!!  Again, waiter has now idea how to save time or even if you can. Waited for "guest services " 5-10 minutes, we went to the main counter and was told YOU CAN NOT SAVE UNUSED TIME. WE WERE TOLD YOU MUST HAVE A "GUEST SERVICE" PERSON COME TO YOU BOOTH AND DO THIS FOR YOU. 
A very aggravating afternoon.

Topgolf allows people to make reservations. I suggest you make one online otherwise you will be waiting for an hour. I had a party of 5 with a 4pm reservation and we only waiting 5 mins at the bar. Every single staff member that we encountered was extremely friendly and took very good care of us. We were escorted up to our bay. We were served by our waitress Lauren. We played for a full hour while enjoying food and drinks. The prices are fairly reasonable. Top golf is perfect for a family outing or even a fun date. The environment is very lively and has music playing in the background. You can dress comfortable as the attire is casual.  I highly recommend top golf to anyone that wants to have a good time and try something new. By the way, you do not have to be a pro golfer to have fun.

This is the perfect place to go for any occasion if you're looking for food, drinks, and games (well of course, golf, but also shuffleboard, foosball, and a few TV games). 

We arrived on a busy Saturday afternoon and waited about an hour or so for our reservation. We grabbed drinks and food at the bar and also played a few games of shuffleboard and foosball! Definitely helped pass the time. I would highly recommend making a reservation.

Once at the driving range, anyone can join in on the fun - I have never done any sort of golfing besides mini golf and had a fantastic time. You can play a continuous game with your friends until the time runs out. Each hour cost is based on when you are there (cheaper for earlier, more expensive later). Seats were comfy wherever we were, lots of things to do, and heaters at every station in case it was cold like the time we came. The whole place is three stories! Hopefully you get a station more in the center because shooting into the targets would be much easier.

All of the servers were great from the bar to our table at our station. Fried pickles, fries, and s'mores were perfect to go with our drinks. The only thing I did not like was the jalapeno strawberry margarita - such a weird mix of flavors and had the consistency of syrup (ew..). All the other drinks were delicious though.

WOULD RECOMMEND! I just wish there was a Top Golf in Southern California.

Great idea for a date night! My husband and I just recently moved back to Az and this was a great addition to the area.The only thing is they should get some kind of screen protector because the bugs can crawl around on it and change the scores! Whoopsies, but what are they to do about nature?

This is the second year that our daughters have participated in the the Kidzone Summer Academy. It is the only summer program that they have participated in and truly enjoyed. The director Daniel Sullivan is on point with staying in communication during and through out the year. The kids are provided lunch that is tasty. Overall all the teachers are friendly to the student golfers. We will definitely participate in the Kid Zone program through this next year.

105 degrees outside and top golf won't let you bring in a sealed bottle of water. Falls back on policy and health code violation.  Horrible service Top Golf, we won't be back all over a 35 cents bottle of water.

Hey everyone just have to say as a 4 handicap golfer the place is a joke, very nice people that don't know a thing about golf. Would have rather played a video game..the interactive scoreboard or rather uninteractive leaves alot to be desired as one of the things that I really wanted to do while I was here in Vegas I was thoroughly DISAPPOINTED. find something else to do

Came down to topgolf on a Sunday night with the mrs and my friend and his mrs. The view is incredible...we sat at one of the bars while we waited for our tee box to be ready...the entire atmosphere is chill...the staff was amazing...we booked an hour but it ended going by really fast so we extended it for another 30 min. We ordered some appetizers, solo drinks, and a big tank of beer....total with tip for the 4 of us came out to $280...definitely not cheap but the experience was cool...
Kelton G was an awesome server! A true hole in one! We had a great time and we will definitely be back.

Once you can get past the front check in people top golf is a 5 star place. The service at check-in, over the phone, and at reservations are what kill this place. I tried to reserve a bay for a bachelor party and for over a week no-one answered the phone or returned messages. When I went in to make the reservation in person, the fees were crazy. Reservations were limited to level 3 & 4, a bay fee of $105 per hour (that is the peak hour fee & is $10 more than the posted walk-in rates) with a $250-350 F&B minimum depending on who you talk to. On top of that, they charge an extra 7% service charge on your bill for using a reserved bay! That's crazy!

Obviously decided to forgo the reservation and just had one of the people in our group volunteer to come earlier to put our name down for a bay. Ended up getting our bay after waiting a little over an hour. The servers at the Birdie Bar were fantastic in taking our orders and transferring them to our bay once we got one. Once we got to our bay, the staff was just as great. The food was better than we expected and like I said earlier, the experience once we got past the front was 5 stars.

This place is great!  It would get that last star if they did not limit us to irons...  Someone made a big boo boo when they opened this place and did not design the range to support long woods or hybrids... Other than that the place is a lot of fun.

We had heard a lot about how fun Top Golf is. Having never swung a golf club in my life (other than in a couple of mini golf outings), I was skeptical about how much fun it could possibly be for a non-golf enthusiast. We decided to give it a shot for my hubby's (also a non-golfer) birthday and we had a great time. We paid $5 for the lifetime membership card and put our name in to rent out a bay for five of us. At $45 per hour, it was a great deal. We waited in the bar area for a little over an hour (we arrived at about 9:45pm) before we got the text that our bay was ready.

Gameplay was fun, even though four-fifths of our group were novices. We signed up for an hour of play and extended for another 30 minutes as the original window neared its close. The servers were friendly and attentive; we never had to worry about running out of drinks as they returned to check on us often. Highly recommended as an out-of-the-ordinary night of fun.
Reasonably priced, good food and drinks, fun place to go enjoy hitting white balls with friends.

This place was fun and all but the service sucks took 2 hours for our food to come and by the time our food came it was already time to go, top golf in Houston was much more better even though there were more people the service was outstanding.

So I specifically made a yelp account to leave this review, because I saw it when I was exiting your building and I wanted to share my experience!

But anyway, I've been to Topgolf Scottsdale roughly a handful of times. Always a great experience, everyone is typically very friendly and polite, food is good, golf is fun. However, I wanted to write about my specific experience the last time I was here. I came in a couple Fridays ago and I brought my family. I had a very large family, with several little kids under the age of 12. Everyone was very well accommodating and they helped us with everything, even so much as helping to carry our clubs. 

We got sent down to the first floor, which was totally ok, with younger kids it helped put my mind at ease slightly, knowing I wouldn't have to stress about them getting close to the yellow line. 

We were sent all the way down, I believe bay 101 or 102, so a little ways down there, but we remained in good spirits!

My husband arrived first and had already had the bay reserved for us, he goes to Topgolf quite frequently. 

Almost immediately we were greeted by our server, which is why I am writing this review. She was spectacular, funny, friendly and went above and beyond anything we could have ever hoped. We all felt the need to give her a hug when we left because she treated us as if we were her own family. 

Her name was Torie and we loved her, she was from somewhere around Pittsburgh, in case you have more than one Torie working there! She taught us so much about Topgolf and where the company was going, which was so cool to learn about! She delivered excellent service, giving us recommendations and tips on fun games to play, but she didn't just stop there! She completely surpassed any service we had received before.

Like I mentioned before we had several kids, very young, with us. She was wonderful with them! She made them chocolate milks, brought them cups with lids, and cleaned up every spill we made, and there were plenty of them! All through this, she remained with a smile on her face. She even went so far as giving my youngest golf lessons and tips because he was getting frustrated every time he got up to golf. She worked with him until he was hitting golf balls better than me! Where most people would get frustrated with a group like ours, she didn't show it at all. 

She made our experience unforgettable. We kept her running back and forth because we were eating, drinking and hanging out with friends from out of town. It wasn't until we got up to leave, before we noticed how much walking back and forth she must have done for us, and she never let it show. Once we got up and realized she must have walked so much taking care of us, my husband tried to hand her additional cash for our gratitude, which she refused, insisting we had already left plenty. We hid it under the ketchup bottle anyway! She was amazing and cared so much about our experience, which warmed my heart. The bay next to us also couldn't stop raving about how great she was!

It is clear she loves the company, and what she does. You have a real gem there, Topgolf. Hold onto her as long as you can because she made our experience unforgettable. 

Please pass this along to her! 

Sorry for the novel, but I wanted to share and let everyone know that Topgolf is a wonderful place! It is so much fun no matter your age, please give it a visit!

Really fun place that has a bit of something for everyone. When we first arrived we were told for level 1 or 2 it'd be 1.5-2 hour wait. I thought we would just be sitting around waiting and bored but they have a huge rec room with games, drinks/bars, TVs and sports. We didn't even have to wait an hour before we were called up for level 1 golf. During that time we drank and played shuffle board... not too bad. Definitely regret not paying the extra ten bucks / waiting the extra time for level 2 or 3. Still had a great time golfing and I'm not even a big golfer!

We came to Charlotte for a quick weekend trip and had to give this place a try. Came on a Sunday evening. So impressed!!! Had a great waitress, so relaxing and enjoyable! We paid for an hour but we didn't want to stop so we stayed for another hour. We had a great experience!!!
I had a great time there. The golfing was fun and challenging.  The food was excellent and I couldn't of asked for better service than I got from Mac on the first floor.

My husband and I had been here once before and enjoyed it the first time and thought to start coming here weekly to relax and get out to the strip since we are locals and usually avoid the area.

Our most recent visit here was absolutely unacceptable. It was a Friday night and we had a bay on level 3 which was $90 an hour. We had 4 people total and 3/4 had memberships (in order to golf you must have a membership, if you do not have one, it is $5). We stayed for about an hour and a half and had drinks and food. When our bill came, we were charged for 4 memberships even though we only signed 1 person up for a membership. Upon noticing this and asking for this to be corrected, they stated that they had already run our card and that the only way to refund us would be to void the charge and charge it again for the correct amount. HELLO, this would be a total hold of $500 for the weekend. We were not offered an apology but attitude from the so called "hospitality" manager Tammy. I have not encountered such a poor excuse of a manager in recent memory. She was curt and extremely rude, interrupting my husband as he was trying to explain the issue. We were given a BS excuse as to why they charged us unnecessarily and "accidentally". It is my belief that they purposely charge customers for this "membership" hoping you will be too drunk or unaware to notice. At the end of the day it was a stupid $15 on a bill of over $250 for us, but it was about the principle and doing the right thing. Beware if you are going to look for extra charges to your bill!

This place is bull, I have a friend the just had a party for her husbands 40th, top golf just screwed her. The management is not very cooperative. They have the worst customer service, took all the food and drink chips 1/2 hour before the party ended. Our party of over 20 people will never have a party here. Will go somewhere else.

PLEASE GET IT TOGETHER.  Bad experience from beginning to end. Tried to have dinner sat at a dirty table then they totally skipped a dinner. No waitress at the bag, then had to wait 30 minutes because the machine ran out of balls.
Never been to a topgolf before and was so impressed by our server Ellie. She was so fun and helpful and always attentive to all of our needs. Will always ask for her to work our future outings!

If you want to test the athleticism of your family members, this is the place. Shooting golf balls at targets to get points with 20 balls a game. We got an hour for $40 with our veteran discount. Very cool environment, I have attached videos of my family golfing. Cool vibes and if you don't get competitive in this, you're not doing it right. 

Unfortunately, they have rules that you can't do any happy Gilmore swings (a running start) and you aren't allowed to aim for the cart picking up the golf balls. So my personal goals weren't achieved. But I went to top golf yesterday and I'm going back today! So so fun!
Great place to go and have fun.  Long wait to get in, but the wait is because it's very popular.  Food is good, but not great.  However, it's definitely a great place to go have fun.

Super fun golf-ish spot with drinks and decent food!!

Date day for the hubs and I so we stop here for an hour to hit some golf balls.  You can choose different games & you pay for an hourly game play.

The cazadores margarita was decent though I did ask for no salt... Which it did arrive with salt.  We shared the chicken nachos and 2 buffalo chicken sliders.  The food was very decent but next time I said let's order when were almost finished.  

Nice friendly staff here willing to go out of their way to make a customer happy.

With the amount of payroll being spent in the place you would expect to be wowed.  Your not.  

Lack of training and supervision have people standing around, not in the right place or having no idea of what to do.  When our bay was ready we stood for over 10 minutes waiting for a runner (there were four talking to each other right behind me but the desk never called them over.  They misspelled most of our names, the system decided one of our last names was inappropriate and could not be entered.   Three different  people tried but to no avail.   We identified we left handed clubs when checking in  and they forgot them.  The ball dispenser stopped dispensing balls, 20 minutes to get it fixed.  We had three servers who took over from the previous and had no idea of the issues we had experienced.  When we asked for more time to be added do to the delays we got attitude.  The server added 15 minutes but had an attitude. 

Overall, this could be a fun place if they figure it out.
Pretty Upscale..Of course it's Vegas...Overall it was worth the $$$.  After all, time with family is priceless....I definitely recommend..

It is 8/1/2017 4:45pm. My husband and I have been here for an hour.  Nice place. Lots of people here for a Tuesday. Great concept. 
We were up on the third floor  and we
were the only people at the bar, and the bartender completely ignored us. He seemed to be fixated with the girls in the pool, which is understandable, but at least acknowledge the people at your bar. We finally left. The bartender on the second floor the Birdie Bar was great and happy to serve us. 
Would have given 5 stars if we hadn't been completely ignored.

I have always had positive experiences every time I have been to Top Golf! The atmosphere is always fun! The service may be a little bit slower but they have always been friendly and do a great job! Likewise it is always busy every time I go so that is probably why service is slightly slower - I don't blame them at all. 

The food menu is pretty limited, but it is decent. The cheese fries are to die for. Avoid the calamari...it's not the best I've had. I have also had the chips and guac and it's decent, just what you would expect from chips and guac. The salad with goat cheese and pecans is decent too, but would be great if there wasn't so much cinnamon on the pecans. Anyway, just get some cheese fries to help soak up the booze and you will be good!

As for the bar, they have Tito's so I'm a happy camper. They have never gotten my order wrong either so that's wonderful!

In regards to golfing - this place is awesome! I love how they have the TVs set up to show you which area your ball went into (when it goes into a colored area). It is easy to work and anyone can play, not just those who golf regularly. The staff who tends to the golfers are pretty cool and do an amazing job.

All in all, Top Golf is a great place to spend a Friday or Saturday night at, and if you haven't been, I would definitely recommend you give it a try! Even if you are not a golfer =)

This place is crazy fun! Good place to catch up with friends and have a laugh. 
Pricey, but there are staff everywhere waiting on you. (White wine Sangria is delicious)

The second annual birthday trip to Top Golf for my dad will be the last. After ordering food and drinks, it took nearly the full paid hour to receive our food, after reminding the wait staff we had ordered. They managed to squeeze out another half hour, which I am sure is by design. 

Once the food finally arrived we played some more golf and decided to make the most of our time getting additional balls to hit after the time expired. While the wait staff was nearly non existent during our playing time they happened to be cleaning the bay next to us and decided to push all the remaining balls over the edge, because of an arbitrary rule of not having more than one ball out at a time. 

Felt sorry for the people below and thought that could be more dangers than having a few extra balls on our faux grass. We looked at the posted rules and could find nothing about such a violation. 

We decided next time we would just go to a regular driving range with a few flasks and will find another way to spend the $200 we will save by not going back to Top Golf.
Love the staff and the food was great... did I tell you about the golf? Misters misting u in the hot sun.. tv, beer and golf! What a fun place!
Great concept great food and drinks!  This is a must visit while in Vegas!  Guys bring the girls! There's a pool too!
This place is a blast was here for my boyfriends birthday with a very big crew the view was amazing the atmosphere was amazing!!!!!!

We absolutely had a great time.  The place was busy but we got a bay within 5 minutes.  The girls were very helpful and our waitress was outstanding with the service.  

Great view from the second level.  Fun selection of games you can play for every level.  We will absolutely return.

A little rich! Our family went to Topgolf for lunch and to hit some balls and basically check it out. First off not impressed with fact there is a $10 reservation fee for us to come and spend money at their establishment, really not impressed when we needed to change the Rez by an hour and got charged again! Then the $5 lifetime membership, which when using again you must have the physical card present. The food was actually very good, but again not cheap. The driving range aspect was very cool and certainly an experience and even with me complaining, I will likely return, hopefully I don't lose my card! Lol.

Great idea for a driving range!  However,  we chose to go on a Friday night. It was a madhouse. I don't recommend doing this. They assured us of a 1 hr wait. So, we waited and after that hour we were still 19th in line for a bay and we're told it would be another hour and 30 min. 

If you want to practice your swing don't go to Top Golf. If you want to drink and fry a Friday night waiting and drinking with the possibility of hitting a few balls, this is the place for you.

So before I write this review, I should state that I suck at golf. Scratch that, I am basically N/A at golf because, besides the lovely game of putt putt, I have never even swung a golf club. Fast forward to end of review..... I had so much fun at Topgolf!

My husband and I came over his lunch break one Monday that I had off of work. The setup was super impressive and the inside is very nice looking. His company is a Platinum card holder so we got the royal treatment (ie. didnt have to wait in any lines and got fancy golf clubs). At first, I was barely getting the ball off the tee. However, at the end, I was hitting the targets like crazy! We played for a bout an hour and a half. Since the Platinum card comes with Topgolf games for free, it was nice not to have to worry about timing of how long we were playing. 

The waitresses stopped by regularly and we ordered pulled pork sliders and chips/salsa/guac. The sliders were delicious and the guac was nicely made. 

Overall, I am a huge Topgolf fan after this experience. It was a fantastic way to spend my Monday afternoon and we will definitely be back!

One of the coolest spots around and I don't golf at all. Awesome place, technology makes this place amazing, amazing server(Bali)  who gave me a vet discount and pushed me to the front of the line, delicious food and the MAN-mosa was great. I'll be back many times in the future

Went here for a corporate social event during a convention so everything was complimentary.

Tried the sliders, bruschetta, tuna tartare and lobster rolls. Everything tasted great and the sliders even had a dash of spicy ketchup in them. Service was great, from the waiters walking around with hors d'oeuvres to the bartenders serving us great pours of Oban.

Didn't play golf but those who were looked like they were having fun. It was fun just to watch and we had a great time!
Fun place!  Food and drinks are great and reasonably priced.  I'll be going often once the weather gets a tad cooler

The golf range is really cool however the worst part about the place is the food. I had food poisoning from it. My family members had the same issues with top golfs food. I asked what everyone ate that made them sick and they all said they had appetizers chicken in it!!!! Stay away from the chicken. I'm giving this place 2 stars only because the range is cool but over priced!

I have been here quite a while. Had the best experience all these time untill the last two.. i have always came here during  the day which i may say it was awesome  the staff kept up with everything(food, drinks, refill) always checking  in on us. Each time  we always  hit the  bar after words. Till i went during  the evening place was pack and had a group  of 9. -.- lets start  by saying the server  didn't  show up to often. We all order food at once  so we wouldn't confuse  him. He had a smile  on his face but knew something  was wrong. Only 3 plates  showed  up when good came and when wr ask him where the rest was he replied  by saying he forgot. An average  drink took about 15 min.  And we had to hunt our server down for our  tab. At the end we still think its a awesome  place but will not go at night, it sucks.!

In one word: Fantastic. 

This is a destination golf facility that doesn't disappoint. I was recently in Scottsdale with my girlfriend who was initially nervous about the golfing experience. When we arrived, we checked in, went to get a beer and were immediately moved into our bay. I can't say enough about the atmosphere - service is great, people are laid back and everyone is having a good time. There are plenty of ways to score points, and plenty of games for people to play, so everyone ends up having a great time!

On top of that, the food is amazing. We had both the Mango Habanero wings and Buffalo Chix flatbread - both were excellent. Tables around us were also happy with their food.

Note: GET THERE EARLY. Friday/Saturday nights, the wait can be as long as three hours. We went Sunday afternoon, and there was no wait.
I had a great time celebrating my boyfriends 23rd birthday, the food was great and our server Camila was awesome, thank you so much! I recommend the nachos, delicious!
