-Pricing is by the hour by the bay (up to 6 people per bay).
-Prices escalate as the day goes on - I believe $25 an hour per bay until the noon, then $35 from noon to 4pm, and then $45 the rest of the day

I'm not even an avid golfer - or golfer at all. In fact, even put put frustrates me. However, I LOVED playing here. We had a very long wait to play, so we decided to eat while we waited. Surprisingly, the food was EXCELLENT. It took quite some time to get our food, but we were there during their busiest time - Saturday night. The food and drinks ARE pricey, but everything is delicious. Overall, great food, great fun, great time. Smaller children would have a TOUGH time waiting, but it's an excellent outing for young adults and up. We'll definitely be back.
We had an amazing time!  Great fun for all of our party.  Even with my lack of golf skills I still had an excellent time.  The food was terrific too!

Lots of fun. From the employees in general to the atmosphere this place is completely perfect for a fun Saturday. We were visiting from Orange County (build one in the OC) and came here in a group on Valentines Day. We waited about 30 minutes and hung out in the bar prior. The drinks were good and well priced in my opinion. It can get a little pricey at night, when we went, but its all worth it in my opinion!

What a fun experience this is! I arrived reasonable early about 10am, and I signed up for 30 minutes since it was my first visit and I wanted to see how it all worked. It was just myself and my wife, I was the only one hitting balls, while my wife used the the free wi-fi. Our hitting station have a 5 seat high top or I could have request a sofa seating about the same number, we have our own TV with the college football on and a screen for everyone to see the hitter scores and distances. I had a great time the 30 minute flew by, I will be back with friends for some friendly competition! The food & drink were reasonable prices but prices per hour do go up the later in the day you visit, but if you are splitting it 3-4 ways it's not bad, depending on how much beer you drink!

Ahh Top Golf, you are an enigma to me.....some of my experience was an over the top 5 star review and some of it wasn't worth a 1 and probably more deservedly needs a call to the health department.
Many people have complained about the check-in....it's a little ludicrous, but a little research will save you time (Pro tip: get your membership ahead of time and reserve your bay early). 
The one BIG plus...for this place being such a madhouse, none of the employees were rude or pushy.
The game itself was great. Staff explained options and it was just fun. This the 5 star part. I'm not a golfer, but it's kind of like a high-end bowling alley...but golf. The food was good too.
Now the zero.....
Bathrooms!!! Top Golf needs more or they need to keep them monitored. It's just unacceptable to have the ladies room closed especially when you're on a 5-hour wait. The men's room was open but it such a sorry state the health department would have closed them down. I usually don't' advertise when I puke, but that great BBQ Grilled Cheese I had eaten an hour before came right up because of the nausea inducing men's room. 
Besides the checkin and the bathrooms this was a pretty fun night, but I would wait until the new factor wears off before returning.

Not a fan.  Contrived, with terrible rental clubs (of course with top golf brand) and low flight balls.  Had to buy a glove because of course they couldn't provide one.  They charge to become a member, charge for gloves, charge for the bay, charge for the food, charge for the drinks, charge for the air to breathe.  

Scoring system is a joke.  The targets are like drains so everything tunnels to them, especially the ugliest struck shots.  Only thing that was good was the service.  Won't be back.

Came here for the first time over the weekend and had a BLAST. I wish they had these in CA. First of all, I am horrible. But it's such a relaxed atmosphere. Our server was so nice and attentive. We ordered drinks and chips and queso. The queso was amazing, salsa and quac not so much.  I had the mac and cheese burger which was huge and amazing. My boyfriend had wings and our friend got sliders which were great. I would definitely come back all the time if they were in CA.

Super fun place to go with the family. Food and cocktails were top notch. Felt like we were in Vegas except for the gambling. Just be prepared to pay for it all, pricey place. Still give it 5 stars because we had so much fun.

Always a great time. This place is for anyone that wants to chill with friends and hit (or try and hit) some golf balls and have some fun. Can get pretty loud, they always have music blaring. Causal/energetic ambiance. TVs for sports at every bay.
From a team event perspective this is one of the best options out there if you have a group of 12+ and can take over a couple of bays. Solid food, good craft beer selection and solid vibe.

This place looks amazing, great facilities...but that will never make up for the absolute worst service I have experienced in Arizona.  
We were told our wait for a golf spot was 30 minutes.  So we went to the bar to have a drink.  We sat at a dirty table that never got bussed for over an hour while we waited for our golf lane that was only supposed to be a 30 minute wait.  Not only that, but no one took our order for 20 minutes, then only served us one drink and we never saw them again.  It took us going to get a front desk staffer to find our waiter to close out our bar tab.  We were so frustrated that we ended up asking for a refund and leaving.

Topgolf was a great place to go to while in Vegas. It's got big tv screens, very nice swimming pools on two different floors with swim up bar, live music, food & a few bars on each floor. It's definitely a group outing place. Good for families with kids. I definitely would go back again! Wish they had a Topgolf in Los Angeles!! Awesome place for sure!

Top golf is always a fun, laid back option for entertainment with friends or family. Top Golf is just a big range and you take turns hitting golf balls in the attempt to get your ball into large holes. Hitting the golf balls into farther holes gets you more points. You get a lane kind of like bowling and you get charged by the hour for the use of the lane and individual membership cards (which are a one-time $5 charge and can be used at any Top Golf). It was quite chilly in Vegas and my group was placed in the last lane. The last lane only had one overhead heater while the other lanes had 2 heaters to keep warm. So we were cold and uncomfortable in our lane. My friends and I ordered food and just relaxed and played our round. I ordered the pulled pork sliders which came with tater tots. I wasn't impressed by the food. I ate the tater tots and didn't really enjoy the pulled pork sliders. The bbq sauce used for the sliders was too sweet.

Order the breakfast sandwich (high ratings from my son).  

Busy place and we waited about 10min for a bay (which isn't bad at all).  Game room is pretty nice while waiting (for said bay). TV screens across the green are a nice touch.  Only difference here is their games don't have the 15th hole challenge (like in Denver).

Great service, good food. Amazing staff who does not give you a hard time and just want you to have fun. This is the place to be from the young kids to the older crowd who want to enjoy a nice drink and have some fun. I come here every year when I'm on vacation and always leave with a smile

Geno, Phillipa and Bailey are AMAZING! Such a great experience here! From walking up to Geno in MGM he was very personable and even said when we're back from Top Golf to come see him so he can recommend places for our Honeymoon. We then get into the Shuttle and Phillipa was nothing but AMAZING! She held a conversation with us the whole ride. Very sweet! I wish I met more people like her! Now Bailey our host on the first floor. She is super sweet too! Came up to us with a smile and has helped us the whole time. All three I think should get a raise!! They are all amazing! I will be back because of them!

If you've been to other locations...you will be disappointed. Service is very subpar. Pay twice as much for less than half the service you get at other locations. Been going to Top Golf in AZ since 2014. My kids love the place. We couldn't wait to try out the Vegas location that is supposed to be bigger and better. Definitely bigger, but not better. If you want to charge double, service needs to step it up. One can only hope this is a one off...

Update: Went the other night with some friends and we sat down at a table in the bar area. Sat for 20 minutes and no one acknowledged. Walked by table multiple times clearing other tables that had since departed. Got up and left!

Staff is always friendly and great here. Stopped in for the weekend and kids of course wanted to play. Tried night golf for the first time and boys had a blast. Food is great here and service is always top notch. Great time and family friendly.

This place is cool.

I came here recently for the first time with a buddy of mine to check the place out.  He had been there before and I hadn't swung a club in years.  Needless to say, I dusted off my clubs and we were off.

(Quick tip: you are not allowed to bring in your drivers but you can check them at the desk if you forget to leave them at home.  They have clubs you can use there)

After checking in, we headed over to our bay and checked out the digs.  The bays are pretty cool in that they have places to secure your clubs and comfy sofas to relax on.  We looked at the available games and started working through them.  There are several styles of games you can play based on the different targets that are out on the range.  It can definitely test you and force you to work on your accuracy.

We had a couple of beers and played for a couple of hours.  I have not had the food yet but I have heard that it is pretty good.  For now, I am satisfied, I had fun, and I am excited to come again in the future.

Fun place to go for a corporate event or with a group of friends. Definitely pricey (food, drinks and the golf). Food is okay but not why you go...you go for the fun atmosphere and ability to hang out with friends. Wait can be long, depending on timing. Staff is often around to order drinks or food from or help with the scoring machine. Bring your own clubs if your a serious golfer.

Well I don't like giving bad reviews but this is an exception.  I love Top Golf and always have fun when I go.  The restaurant however is a different story.  Tonight 6 of us went to the restaurant and for the most part it was ok for the other people in our group, food was good and there were no complaints.  I however cannot say the same.  I told the waiter I wanted the fried chicken sandwich with no cilantro coleslaw on it.  I'm sure he heard me because he nodded his head and said "No coleslaw" and I said yes.  Low and behold it was delivered with the coleslaw.  I should have sucked it up and ate it, but I HATE COLESLAW!  Waiter apologized and took it back and promptly forgot about me.  I waited 40 minutes to get my sandwich with no coleslaw on it.  When it arrived I declined to take it.  Everyone else was done eating, and I was a bit upset about it and had lost my appetite by then.  Luckily I grabbed the Tator tots of the original plate to tie me over.  Only problem...they were very cold.  Manager stopped by and apologized I accepted his apology and he said that he would take care of it for us.  Cool!  Well that didn't happen.  We got the check and lo and behold they charged us for the chicken sandwich.  I told the waiter I was not going to pay for something I didn't eat.  He took it off the bill then.  Not acceptable.

This place is INCREDIBLE!!  Disclaimer: I've never done this before... holy smokes people from getting signed up to getting to our bay, the bay host service... everything has been EXCELLENTLY SUPERB!!! It's a mission from where we live, but I promise I'll use any excuse to come back. Also the food and drinks are ON POINT!!! Thank you Topgolf for a fantastic experience

I paid for a 1-hour individual lesson. I am basically a newbie with a little par 3 experience. Within an hour Ryan had my swing dramatically improved. Well worth the money - and excellent facilities. Can't wait to go back.

Gameplay is fun but horribly disorganized facility.

Bartenders are slow. We could have had 2 drinks before they even took our order.

No reservations taken unless you pay 50 dollars to skip queue, which we only found out late. 

Half the bays were open yet we were made to wait 2 and a half hours, after which we left.

Drinks were good, once we got them, food was decent except for the chips, which were disgusting. Like Doritos without flavoring.

Music was awful.

Typical Scottsdale douche baggery, except with no sense of business and lame customer service.

Prices are also on the high end making the experience even worse.

Tried to order flatbread but was out of the bread. Food was subpar at the best. Had to ask for shot on the side for my Bloody Mary...tasted like all tomato juice. After waiting in my tab I noticed how uncleanly the staff was. The bartender had her foot propped up on the ice bin. Another bartender and two waitresses was observed eating out of the garnish bin...after bartender ate the cherry he picked up he then licked his finger and continued to make drinks and picking up garnish with the same hand he licked!!!!

I learned about Top Golf because they are building one in my area which is scheduled to open on September 3rd. So, when I found out there was a Top Golf in Vegas I was excited to try it out. I'm an avid golfer and the people with me golf sometimes. Although, that does not really matter here, because the whole idea is to just have a fun time. Almost everybody around us was either not regular golfers or never swung a club in their life; and everybody was having so much fun.
The staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint was it was hard to hear the woman at the main check-in counter, partly because her voice was not that strong, but also because the accoustics in the main entrance/check-in counter are not that good. It was to noisy, which made it hard to hear.
The gentleman who explained the games and how things worked did a pretty good job. He went kind of fast, but the system was intuitive enough where we were able to work ourselves through it while we were playing.
The clubs kind of suck, but what do you expect for a place like this? For someone who does'nt normally golf, they are fine, for someone who plays even a few times a year you're better off bringing your own clubs.
My only real complaint about the golfing was the rubber tee. It was fine for all the clubs except the driver, since it was only about less than 1/2" tall. It makes hitting the driver very difficult, even for a decent golfer.
Anyway, overall a very good experience and I can't wait until the Top Golf near me opens.

Very disappointed. For the first time in my life I did not leave a tip. From the moment I got there Alexis acted like being there was a bother to her. As I walked up - her face looking perturbed - she asked if we had a reservation for the bay. She didn't realize that a staff member was following behind us. Thirty minutes later we saw her again and she advised she had an event that she was setting up for and that she wasn't supposed to have anyone in our section and apologized for the delay in coming to us. We let her know it was no problem and no need to apologize. From that point on we saw her sporadically. Everyone in our group had to ask for drinks and items multiple times. She constantly cut and rolled her eyes, never picked up plates, never refilled drinks, and every request seemed to be a nuisance to her. I asked for to go boxes twice and 40 minutes later we had not received the Togo boxes. . . We let her know a third time that we still had not gotten them and her response "I'm grabbing them (pointed in a general direction) I had other stuff I was doing." Then proceeds to reach in the drawer DIRECTLY behind us and grab to go boxes. Ridiculous. TopGolf is usually a great experience. But this week Alexis ruined the experience.

Clean, organized, great customer service.

We arrived at 8pm on a Wednesday night May 17, 2017. We only had to wait 10 minutes. 

We can with 2 other friends, we all came prepared with our TopGolf Member Cards to speed things up.

It was $45 an hour and you get 10% with military discount.

Earlier in the day it's only $25 per hour and per bay. It's not per person. You can have up to 6 people per bay. 

We only played for an hour, but we had a good time and everyone was really friendly.

We called to see if we needed reservations for a group of 8 and the person on the phone said we needed to get in touch with an event coordinator. They were not helpful over the phone at all. 

On a Thursday, we did expect to have to wait or even not get in line at all.

We went to get register for two bays, the person asked if we had a reservation. We said no, we called and they said we cannot get a reservations for a group less than 12. 

They said that's a unique situation. Not having a reservation for a group of 8. They even called their manager out to clarify that we didn't have reservations for a group of 8. They politely told us the wait was too long and we wouldn't be able to get on the waiting list or play tonight.

They gave us $10 off for next time we come it. 
Poor customer service, not professional and just straight up rude.

You don't have to be super good at golf. You just need to be able to hit a ball, land it on the scoring net and have fun. This place is perfect for a group event since they can take up to 6 people per spot. I guess one down side is that you have to wait so long on the weekends but it will go by fast if you hang out in the main bar area and they will text you when it's your turn. They have a huge tv screen at the bar so you can watch sports games too!
Cost friendly, super fun and great for dates or groups! Recommend getting the 3rd level!
This is by far my favorite Top Golf location. Timber was my server this time and she was amazing! Food came out on time and she was so pleasant to be around and catering to mine and my family's needs

I came for my birthday. Their  was a mix-up with credits on my membership account but was able to still let us play the bay .Overall it was a good experience.

Surprisingly it was packed on a Wednesday night like really packed.
There was a 2 1/2 hour wait for a bay but we had planned on eating anyways so that wasn't an issue. The food and drink menu is varied and everyone was able to order to their liking. I will not I ordered a corona-rita and my waitress said they didn't have one which is weird.

Pros: Menu, music,staff, bay reservation alert via text
Cons: Parking- I don't understand why more parking wasn't planned. 
The process for getting your physical membership card in one line then getting in another to reserve a bay; process was not smooth and definitely needs to be improved especially when busy. 

Tips: Definitely carpool or Uber if possible. go with the intention to eat so the possible 2-hour wait doesn't seem so shocking

Always a good time here. We went around 5:30pm on a Saturday and did not have to wait for a booth. Booth was clean and staff was very friendly. The booth had a little mister that shot out a cool mist every so often so that was nice for the Vegas heat. It was a little on the pricey side (but I have to remember it was a Saturday evening in Vegas). I would recommend this Top Golf.

Food was good typical bar fare (3.5 stars is about right) . I don't like the fact that you can't bring your own clubs here. Heard you can at some of the other locations. I'll try another location next time.

Had an unpleasant experience at Top Golf and it was my first time.   Our friends had a $200 credit so we were going to be there a few hours having fun or so we thought.  We were not even there 45 mins, the server cut our friend off after two shots, while we were allowed to continue to purchase the $20 drinks.  It killed our whole vibe.  I will say the food is good, drinks are ok but the service all around sucks!  

The servers are a bunch of girls and guys all stuck on themselves and flirting with each other all day!  While at the top level bar we witnessed our bartender taking selfies in between making drinks! 

Would I go back?  Probably not.  Vegas is supposed to be about service, which is not what I experienced at Top Golf.

When to top golf for the first time a few months ago with my husband and our friend who is a Vegas native. The golf was fun and the games were a blast. But my main issues have to deal with the customer service that we received.

Side note: our bartender that we dealt with in the second level was fantastic and the only reason why I didn't give one star. He was a blast, and was very attentive to us. 

Getting back to the poor customer service on the Bay Area. The lady that took our order seemed to care less about our table but FAR MORE ATTENTIVE  to the group of young men behind us, and seemed to be flirting too. Which I would not mind if she ever brought us our drinks. We had to ask another waitress who was walking by to grab her and have her bring us our drinks. Finally they came, and they were delicious (hats off to the bartender!). After our game time expired we were still waiting for our check, and then another 10 minutes goes by and no sight of our waitress. We grab another waitress( who was amazingly sweet) to grab her or our check. She couldn't find her and just brought us our check for us! She was great and the bartenders! 

Needless to say, not impressed, see no need to return, AND WE LOVE GOLF!
So I got here and I ordered 6 shots. First 3 were liquor and the next 3 where ordered chilled.... chilled means with ice. Do not order chilled shots. It means watered down....

We always have a great time here and after visiting the Edison NJ location, we were so glad that we would finally get a Topgolf near our new home. We have so much fun with the different games because none of us can play golf if our lives depended on it. The drinks are good, the food is good. The only thing I would say is that with the set up of their service, I would order and eat inside or outside. The people that serve inside at the bar get ripped off in tips when people transfer their tab outside. I don't think that is fair since we did the majority of our ordering, eating inside. Once you get outside, make sure they give you silverware. I don't know why but they never seem to remember to give us silverware.

EXPENSIVE - LONG WAIT - POOR PARKING
$90/hr and a 2 hour wait!!!
Mandatory $5 surcharge that they dont tell you about until you get to your lane.
$5 soda cups.
Fun atmosphere

First of all this place is NOT for locals and NOT for golfers. It's a nightclub tourist trap that happens to have a drive range attached. Locals and people who actually want to golf - go to a local municipal range for $8 all day. That being said...

PARKING:
Parking was horrendous. You have to valet and traffic was backed up out on Koval. Fights among motorists on Koval Ln. No self parking. Sat in valet for 15 mins before they took my car. When I tried to leave it was a 30 minute wait to get my car out of valet! Your best bet would be to Uber to MGM Grand or Hard Rock Café and walk over.

PRICES:
The prices are a complete rip off. $90 for 1 hour and then its a 2-3 hour wait to get a lane. Then when you get to your lane they hit you with this $5/day surchage bullsheet that there is no mention of at the check in counter. So in addition to the rates there is another $5 fee. Food is priced reasonably but drinks are outrageous. Soda cups are $5.

WAIT TIMES:
Just ridiculous. Massive bottleneck of people as soon as you enter. Upon checking in at the main counter I was told the wait for a range was 1.5hrs. We waited 2 hrs before we got a lane. They text you that a lane is avail and you have to wait in line yet again at the main counter.

STAFF:
Very friendly employees but lack of communication between employees. Waitresses all smokin' hot 21 year old females with extremely short skirts (they didn't get their jobs due to experience or college education, trust me). Guys...expect to hand over some big tips.

This place is definitely fun, awesome atmosphere and all that. But it's just way too overpriced and the wait times and parking are just insane.

First time going to Top Golf, but I am very glad our group decided to come here to celebrate a couple friend's birthdays. When we initially arrived on a Saturday night at around 9:30pm, we expected it to be super busy with a long wait, but we were wrong. We only waited 15 minutes for our Level 3 bay. The whole experience was top-notch! It felt like being at a lounge/club-like atmosphere along with a high-tech driving range where the balls are tracked via RFID so it can precisely score where you hit the color target areas. Our hostess and other employees were very friendly and attentive. The drinks were alright and the best food item we ordered were the "adult" donut holes. I highly recommend that dessert especially going in the evening after having dinner. I will definitely be back to Top Golf next time I'm in Las Vegas!

3 stories of golf bays and girl's serving drinks and food in Capri pants... breathtaking mountain views in the background and a patio upstairs with more games and fun. Foose ball, grown up bar version of jenga, video games as well. Night time is more like a club atmosphere. Days see more serious ( read real) golfers. And there is nothing like watching a hottie in heels try to golf after shaking her hips to rap music. Led alone do well at it. Great for groups looking for fun.

Visited this location from out of town (Texas) where I have visited the Dallas, Las Colinas, and Austin locations. Every experience I have at the Dallas location is awful (service could NOT be worse). This location had friendly service but they don't allow you to use tees. REALLY? They claim it's because some people have hit the ball over the 300 ft netted wall. So now everyone else is forced to shoot from one of your 3 remaining clubs that don't require a tee? We played from the bottom floor which basically meant we couldn't aim for anything other than the three holes directly in front of us. For the amount you pay to play here to basically hit a wedge, 8, or 6 iron, I'm sorry this fucking blew. We had planned on coming tomorrow too but not anymore. We'll take our 300+ dollars of business to the casino instead, since the few people who are that awful at hitting a driver ruined it for everyone else.

Service was top notch. Everyone from the first person who greeted and filled us in on how things work, to our food server. 
Food was surprisingly excellent too.  We ordered the taco party platter plus some wings. Was good amount for 5 hungry guys.  Everyones favorite seemed to be between the bulgogi and carnitas tacos.
As far as the golf, I am no pro and i thought it was super fun.  Prices are reasonable.  If you want to have a relax fun time with some food and drinks, this place is the spot. Would def. go again.

This place is AWESOME! My husband typically entertains clients there when in town and said it would be fun for us to go as a family with the kiddos. He was right! Our boys had a blast, we had a blast, the food is delicious, and the service is exceptional by each and every employee. Everywhere you turn someone's greeting you with a smile, asking if we would like something and returning with drinks and food in a flash. Will surely come back the next time we are in town.

Food is pretty good. Nice bar inside. Make sure you have plenty of people to share your pad. That way you rotate playing games and get your money's worth. We had 3 people and only 2 played. It gets old lol....and tiring.

Pretty cool place. If you have a group of friends and  don't mind spending a fairly high amount for food, drinks and some round robin golf, then you gotta try this place. 

With over thirty family and friends in town for the big game, (UH vs UNLV), we wanted to do some kind of outing that we all could enjoy and still allow for everyone to spend time visiting. 

Cousin mark set it up. Our reservation was for 10pm. Not sure if that's the last time or not, but after two and half hours of fun, we where walking out to an almost empty place. 

Upon arriving, there was a live band playing, there are two levels, we where on top. The room reserved was quite large with an enclosed glass surround, long table for eating, a center bar with two tee's. There where couches and smaller tables for sitting and socializing offering a place to set your drink. 

Once the food and drinks had been ordered, we took turns practicing our swing, trying to get that connection that would send that little white ball sailing through the air and land just right in the colorful holes out on the range. I never made it and gave up. It was too much fun watching the others connect!

There are large screen TV's for staying up with all things sports, a private bathroom in the suite and two very attentive servers, keeping the food and drinks flowing! It's a great place to enjoy good company. Definitely should be on the to do list.

I've been to this top golf lacrion a few times and this trip we had timber. She was amazing so friendly. Not only was her service amazing but she made our experience memorable with her outgoing personality. Well definitely be back
Fun place to come to with friends. I went in and they weren't very good at explaining everything to it was a bit confusing at first. The explanation could've been better but overall had a great time

Ordered 6 items and only got 3 and after like )have an hour of finishing the 3 items(food) we got we told the server that we are missing 3 more items and the she said "what were they again?" so from that we knew they didn't make the remaining 3 items yet and if we were going to wait for them to make those items, it would be another 30 more minutes or more, it was my first time and unfortunately i'm never coming back again

This place is so awesome! We had a great time here although it's a little embarrassing when you're not a golfer and are sitting next to a bay of golfers.but who cares right? Great place for all ages. You have to pay$5 for a registration card which I find odd, but it's supposed to be lifetime so I guess it's fine. Then you pay per hour. Make sure you tell them if you're not ready to start your time or else valuable $$$ will be wasted! You get your own private bay with a tv and either high chairs or couches to accommodate your group. Food and drinks is a la carte so your night of posh driving range can add up really quickly. The games they offer are fun but I still don't know how it tracks my specific ball when I hit it in the range. Technology is amazing! Everything we ordered was delicious although they ran out of a lot of food. No chicken and waffles, no crab cakes and no calamari. Bummer since I wanted to try all 3! The sign says Purell is located everywhere but I didn't see any and considering I'm a germaphobe, I would suggest having one at every bay. Lastly, they are pet friendly! You're forced to be on the first floor unless you're a service dog and then you can be anywhere. Will definitely be back!
Great service! If only I knew how to play golf properly, I would look less of an idiot....Nice venue! Great staff! Reasonable food and beverage prices....

Such a great place to hang out with friends, have some drinks and hit some balls. Impeccable service, amazing venue and great energy is what you always get when you come here. The good is great also! The cabana platters are delicious. Would definitely recommend Top Golf to visitors as well as locals.
This place is great!! No matter if you golf or not you will have fun! Kids are welcome; We took our 12 year old daughter!

I went to TopGolf on Saturday with my husband, parents, and a friend from out of town. While the gameplay was fun, the customer service was absolutely pitiful. The check-in process was extremely confusing and the staff was not helpful. I would make sure to give any newcomer a thorough explanation of the check-in process before visiting in hopes they don't have the same experience I did. 

With 3 of us playing being new, we were a little unsure where we needed to go first. We went to the front desk and they told us we needed to get in line for Guest Services. We went across the lobby and waited in line for Guest Services. We were finally helped by two separate cashiers, but since we were all playing in the same bay, we moved to one cashier. They asked if we wanted our own player cards, and not knowing, we asked what they recommended. They said we can all play on one player card and since we'd have to pay for extras, we decided just to use the one player card. We didn't even know what the player cards did. 

We walked back over to the front desk where we were given clubs and taken to our bay. While the employee was getting us set up, he told us we'd all have to play under the same name with only one player card. We, of course, did not want to do this. It's like bowling with only one player on the screen - no one does that! So we had to go back inside to get player cards.

I went to the front desk and told them I'd just been there, but I was told I needed a player card. The employee said I needed to go to Guest Services, where the line had tripled in length since we were just there. I said, "Wait, seriously? We have to wait in that line even though we were just here??" She just said, "Yep." No apology. No sympathy for the pregnant woman (me) having to stand in line for the next 10+ minutes after already waiting in line for 5 minutes earlier. There were about 5 employees at the front desk standing around doing nothing. 

The cashiers in guest services were also not apologetic about the situation and couldn't seem to care any less about all the inconvenience we encountered to try to play. I was visibly upset and no one apologized.

The staff seemed extremely under-trained and under-experienced, and I will not rush to bring my business back here anytime soon.

This is a great place for a team event or to go with a group of friends. We had no wait during lunch on a weekday or at 11:30 on a Sunday. The most popular game is a lot of fun and great for people who don't play golf. It's easy for those who don't hit the ball well to still get a decent amount of points making it to the targets. The food is also pretty good. The G.O.A.T and the injectable donut holes were my favorite menu items. The mac and cheese spring rolls, chicken and waffle sliders, buffalo chicken flatbread, and mushi were also very good. We enjoyed the Bloody Mary and Citrus Cabana as well. This is definitely a place worth checking out. We'll be back again!
April fools or not, their cocktails are as WEAK as charmin but love the customer service and all around concept. Just stop cutting corners.

So happy Vegas had one. Great experience and friendly staff. Our server Amy was very attentive and nice. Will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas; it's a great way to hang out with friends, have fun, and get a little fresh air.

This was my 2nd visit to Topgolf, The first visit I left without eating or playing. We had a 2.5 hour wait time, so we decided to eat while waiting. We sat in the restaurant for 36 minutes without anyone coming over or even being acknowledged, so we left. Because of the hype I decided to give it another shot. This time we arrived earlier and the wait time was only 1.5 hours. Again we tried the restaurant, and was greeted after about 10 minutes after we sat down (self seating)The wait time for the bay was shorter than expected (40 minuets) we had to transfer our food to our bay. I truly enjoyed this visit, food was good, cocktails even better. My 6 year old really enjoyed himself and we plan on returning this weekend.  I would recommend as a good spot for kids but also a good date spot.
Great atmosphere, amazing bars and golf and fun and games.  This is where I want to be when the world ends.

Why don't we have one of these in San Diego?!  I came here with some friends when I was in town and I'll admit that I was skeptical at first. I'm not a golfer AT ALL but, I had a really great time! The nice thing is that you don't have to be good at golfing to do well here. I was the least experienced golfer in my group and I didn't even get last place. If you can hit your ball into 1 of the 11 targets (ranging from 20 to 240 yards), you'll get points, which will automatically show up on a screen at your table so you don't have to keep track manually. The concept is a lot like bowling, but it's a driving range. It might seem a little expensive, but it really isn't if everyone playing chips in. 

Another great feature this place has to offer is the bar. More than likely, there will be a wait to play golf because this place is so popular but, you can go hang out in the bar and eat/drink while you wait. It's no different than going to any other bar just to hang out. The atmosphere is really fun and energetic (all of the employees are always dancing and being goofy) so I would probably hang out there even if there wasn't a wait to play golf. Before you know it, it'll be your turn to hit some balls and the fun will continue!

TopGolf Vegas is perfect must check out spot if you like Sports, Golf, Drinking, Plenty of TV's and only at this location you have a sports book, video poker at the full bar and rooftop swimming pool. They also stage for live bands and trendy comfortable sitting areas. It's great for groups because the pricing is typical Vegas! Definitely caters to golfing enthusiasts and sports fans. 

$8 for beers is not bad for Vegas but $60 for an hour is kinda pricey for the first and second levels during the afternoon. I have not hit golf balls for longest time so I was shanking balls. My experience would be better if they had staff to improve your swing.

Staff was rude at the bay. Rushed us out by taking our drinks before we were finished. Wouldnt finish letting us hit the balls dispensed during our hour. Very disappointed in the service. Doesnt compare to other Top Golf facilities. Oh and there are no stadium lights to see your ball after dark and no pro tracer either.

The only reasons I give this place a 4 Star is the price and if you have a party of 6 or less when making a reservation, they will charge you an arm and a leg in food and booze. I was particularly not too happy with the sales person Lucy who wouldn't give my group a little break when a few people couldn't make it. When we got there, one of the managers gladly took a good amount off the bill for us to help. It really restored faith in this place! Still, to swing some clubs around for a short time, you better bring your wallet! Make sure and call to check prices before you come so you know what you're in for. Now as far as this place and how much fun it is... it's a lot of fun! If you really like golf, you should do this for 3 hours if you have 4 or more people with you. I am very impressed with this place when it comes down to it with the music and vibe. Thanks and I will be back for sure.

I absolutely love this place! It's great to go with family and friends to have a fun time! We usually go here on Sunday funday, to let loose and have a good time. They have good food and drinks, the wings are some of the best I've had, and they also have good chicken fingers. The service is great and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Cool facility.  Impossible to get in.  We were told 3 hour wait.  We are going on hour 4.   We haven't touched a ball.  They keep saying that there is two people in front of us and now there are 4 people in front of us.  How is that possible? Super disappointed so far.

We tried to book a corporate event at their faculty.  We have 15 people going which requires two booths at 75 per hour each. We asked that they they be next to each other, they said yes but they would have to double the price to a total of $300 per hour for two booths. I asked why and they simply replied, that's our policy.  I asked about food and they told me for 15 people they have a $800 minimum. The total for a two hour event for 15 people reached $1,600 dollars.  This is insulting to me and my group. I will never give them one dollar and I play a lot of golf and was very excited to use their facility. 

I would recommend that locals avoid this awful business. Thank you for listening to my rant.
Great music,  good food. .. awesome customer service. .. fair prices. .. definitively a good hang out,  especially for groups.  I will definitely come back here.
Chandler (like the city) was excellent. Great waiter!!  Much better than his brother, according to him.  Had a great time

I have always wanted to go to the golf course and hit some rounds. My friends and I decided to check out Top Golf while in Vegas and boy was it an adventure. As a newbie to golf I definitely struggled with picking the right club and hitting the ball but it was fun and cheap. We went before noon so it was $30/hr for the bay. Each player gets 20 balls. We took turns but you could hit them all at once if you prefer. You pick your club and wave it over the sensor and a ball is kicked out to you. Then the swinging begins. If you are like me then you will spend lots of time swinging and missing the ball. You aim at the various targets and the closer inward the higher the points. The balls contain sensors and the points are automatically computed. You are given the option to extend your time during your remaining 15 mins. We declined but only because we had other places we wanted to check out. We all agreed that we would definitely do it again and that we had fun. 

Seating area: The bays are separated with short sectionals and a table. You can order food and drinks and they are brought to you. Each bay has a separate tv, separate clubs for both men and women, and score tracker. 

There are also seats at the bar. 

1st and 2nd level are for adults and kids. Levels 3 and 4 are adult only 21+ and includes a pool. Levels 1 & 2: $30 before noon, $45 after noon, and $60 for the evening time slots. Levels 3 & 4: $45 before noon, $60 after noon, and I cannot recall the evening price. 

New players must get a membership for $5 but it last for a lifetime. We chose the top shot game since we are rookies. We didn't get any alcoholic drinks although they offered a nice selection. Instead we opted for fountain drinks. Drinks before noon make me sluggish and kills my productive. 

We encountered a minor issue when my friend could not locate her coin purse. Luckily she had left it in the car. The staff deserves MAJOR KUDOS. The staff that provides the drinks searched for us very thoroughly. The guy in charge of security assisted as well as the manager. I think his name was Das. Everyone went into search mode. Our bay neighbors also assisted with searching. It was great news to find out that it was not missing just misplaced but in a safe place. So the good news is if an issue does arise here they will definitely go above and beyond to take care of you and help anyway they can.

This place is HUGE. The staff here are welcoming and are everywhereeeeeee. Doors were opened and orders taken quickly. We really wanted 3rd floor, but we had a minor with us so we settled for 2nd. The facility is technology friendly. 

After choosing a club (female and male differ), you wave it over the sensor and a ball pops out. Across the course you have colored hole markers, marking score as you make it into them. I couldn't believe the advanced tech. TV screens informed you of where exactly the ball went into. Trust me, keeping track of that tiny thing is hard. No, the ball cars have no points if you hit the poor suckers. 

Ok....fyi. I SUCKED. Not just kinda sucked, but was insanely horrible. I scored like 10 while everyone got over 20. My only comment on this place would be to wish they had someone show you how to swing a club in order for me to actually hit the ball rather than spending half my time swining air. It was nice to see others sucking just as bad, so I didnt feel too terrible. 

I'm definitely coming back! Local discount for Nevada residents! Check online before coming.

My boyfriend and I love to come to Topgolf anytime we visit Charlotte. He is an avid golfer.. I have been golfing less than 10 times in my life. We both always have a blast. 

Topgolf is basically a driving range with certain targets to aim for. The golf balls have gps, so a computer in your bay tracks where you land. There are several options of games to play that you select on said computer. There are several clubs to chose from in each bay. The bays also have heaters that do a good job of keeping the seating area warm when it is cold out. Each bay also has a table, chairs, and a server for drinks and food.

While visiting this morning we ordered a few mimosas and beers, and our server was quick in bringing them out. We definitely want to try one of the "Golfbag" drinks if we're ever back in the evening.

It can be pricey but the prices increase later in the day, so you can plan a visit early in the day to save money. We went around 10 a.m. this morning and it was still decently busy. It was $25/bay/hour until noon. You can have up to 6 people in a bay, so you can come with friends to make it more affordable.

Overall, a very fun experience for any group. We will continue to visit!

As a local, i thought this place started so great and promising! With their hundreds of staff members, nobody answered our call on 4/11/2018. So we went there, there was a 2 hour wait time. Sitting at the bar area was terrible. Really, customer service and the long queue is an issue. The website does not really help. Hope this business lasts. =(

I'm not a Golfer...so I had no real interest in going to TopGolf...but I had some friends in town and wanted to show them a good time and chat some, plus her husband loves golf.

Well we went to TopGolf and had the best time ever.  It's just like bowling as far as scoring, but with golf balls.  The place is absolutely amazing, it looks great, the employees were very fun and friendly, and the food was delicious and not over priced.   After a few swings I got the hang of it and did pretty well...I didn't win but I look forward to returning and working on my golf skills...  really great family friendly place, great place to hang out with friends...something different in Vegas.

This place is amazing!!!! Opening on June 9th, 2017 this will be the Charlotte area's new "Go To Place."

The concept is simple, and brilliant. You come in, get a membership card (lifetime card costs $5) which you will use to pay for everything. You rent a bay and enjoy unlimited golf with your coworkers, friends or family while being waited on by friendly and fun staff members. The pricing model is simple - see my photos for current pricing at the time of the review. You pay for the bay, which can be split among members of your party if you wish. The bay is yours with unlimited balls for the duration you have it, and it includes your own two sets of clubs.

On the right (see photos) you will see clubs with Carolina Blue (GO HEELS!) inlay, those are women's flex. Those on the left are men's flex. They do not include gloves, so I suggest bringing your own as we did. You can also opt to bring your own clubs if you prefer. 

Once at your bay, you set up your team (similar to the process at a bowling alley.) You can have up to 6 people per bay, and your bay has it's own private seating area and table, plus a dedicated TV you can control.

Each bay has a large outdoor heater, as well as a fan to help you stay comfortable. There are waiters who go around to get your food & drink orders. The food and drinks were fantastic! We tried everything from:
* Jumbo shrimp with homemade cocktail sauce (not too spicy) with grated ginger & avocado
* Mushi - Mexican sushi with a touch of Sriracha
* Smoked Prime Rib
* Charred broccolini
* Deliciously soft roles and soft whipped butter (who doesn't love good bread & butter)?
* Chopped Greek-style salad with pecans
* Mini loaded potato wedges with ranch on the side
* Fresh seared scallops
* Donut holes with injectible fillings (raspberry jelly, chocolate, and Bavarian - don't be afraid to mix them up!)

I learned the hard way the donut injectors have caps that need screwed off. Take them off or you'll make a mess like I did! My favorite was mixing the rasberry with the creme. YUM!

The drink prices were reasonable and modest, and they have something for everyone. Should you have to wait for a bay (even though they have THREE levels of bays), you can grab a seat or a table at any level. (Again, see photos.)

There is abundant space to rent for meetings, conferences, weddings, banquets, birthdays, bachelor parties, etc. They can cater for whatever you need. They are also VERY sensitive to food allergies and unique dietary needs. Their cheeses were all pasteurized (for any fellow preggos out there), and they can accommodate allergies.

The overall vibe was friendly, fun and lighthearted. Great music flowed throughout, and at night when the targets are really glowing, the lights put on a show of sorts as they dance to the music.

When you're ready to golf, you simply grab your club, approach the mat and wave your ball over the large red dot in the top right of the target map (in front of your map). You'll know it worked because a green light will flash from the dispenser letting you know your micro-chipped ball is on its way. You can do this with your hand, or any club... The chip allows the system to keep your score and know which ball was yours. If you don't get it in a target, your score for that ball is 0. The further the target and closer to the center, the higher the score. Each "game" includes 20 balls. You get unlimited balls/games for the time you have the booth rented. 

This was so much fun, and we can't wait to go back. It's conveniently located off 485 with ample parking. It's family friendly, could work for a work mixer, or as a quasi night-scene for drinks, dancing, food, and of course, golf.

Food, drinks, golf and REPEAT!!! I came here for a birthday gathering. I love how they did this place. Its so fun and it's great to bring friends and family, Especially a group of us. Great atmosphere and great service. Down stairs they have pool, and games on the tv. We had a blast!

The staff was great and friendly. Very attentive to your needs when you are golfing and looking for a drink. A fun time for all, even if you  are not a golfer. Me and my husband enjoyed 3 hours of great atmosphere, music, drinks and food. There are 2 pools on the top floors for everyone 21 & over. They have a family friendly floor with games for all to play Bathrooms were big, clean with lockers. If you go before noon it is only $30 for an hour (plus one time membership fee of $5 per person). We were on the 3rd floor and paid $75/ hr but it was well worth the fun. Each bay has a small L shaped couch with a table and lots of misters everywhere. Vegas is hot and they clearly got climate control down to perfection. We will be going back soon. Great time!

Been there three times and had a great time.  Food was surprisingly good, expected cheap bar food and it was actually really good.  Service was average and the drinks are a bit spendy but overall a great time.  Please do not bring babies and toddlers to this place as there is no childcare and no place for little ones to run around. The last time we had to listen to a 3 year old cry and scream for an hour because there was nothing for him to do...
This was a very great place and affordable! It's a good place when to bring a lot of people too. Wess our guest service rep was great!
This place is amazing! Fun for the whole family. Even if your not a golfer it still has its perks. We love to come here! Thanks for all the fun top golf! Food and drinks are also amazing.

Fun place to go! Definitely a pain waiting to get your initial member card...very loud in lobby and with the high popularity it's a mad house, especially on Saturday's. Once you get your card it's much smoother. The wait staff are great, at least ours was. Food is aight, I'd pass on it since it's expensive enough as it is to just play. It's much better when you split the cost per hour with friends. Hour is fun, two hours is plenty, especially if you suck at golf and bend your wrist (ouch). 

I will definitely be bringing more out of town guests to play golf, it's a cool place to go!

The Las Vegas location is an excellent experience. For a place like top golf it's the staff that will make or break your evening. The waitstaff is attentive and management wants to make sure you had the experience you were hoping for. After a night that didn't end well for my group Carrie from the management team took the time to reach out and make it right. I appreciate the dedication to customer service and the desire to develop repeat business.

My hubby and I came here for date night.  Disclaimer...we both have not touched golf clubs in the last decade probably but we still had fun.  It's a pricey place, but you come in expecting as much.  We enjoyed the game concept of it versus going to a golfing range, even though technically this is a glorified golfing range.  They provide the clubs and the balls.  The balls are tracked so you know where they land and depending on the game...they equate to a certain amount of points.  For locals or military, they have a discount...so don't forget to mention that to your server.  Or if you go earlier before noon...they also offer discounts.  We picked the tier 1 since we wanted minimal wait time, and less witnesses to our subpar golf skills.  Next time, I'd try the upper levels since they offer a better for view.  I would eat dinner before I get here, the food was mediocre at best.  We got the pork skewers as a snack...and they were as dry as jerky.  Probably best with a group of 4 if your only going for an hour, any additional people and you won't get to hit too many balls.

I took friends here that were visiting from out of state who love  to golf on Oct 10th 2014. We went to rent out two golfing stations and there was some type of glitch in the computer system. We had a rock star in training who was waiting on us and was having some issue with the computer. We were patiently waiting for at least 20 minutes to have the issue solved. I am not sure what happened however the manager Cory came over fixed the problem and comped both stations for free for the inconvenience. Now that's what I call great customer service. Thanks Top Golf, I will definitely be back.

Apparently they are very busy even on a Tuesday night, I tried to call multiple times but the automatic recording kept on telling me that all staff members are busy, so I was kept on hold. Finally got fed up and had to email them to ask my question. I work as a ER nurse at a hospital a few miles away from Topgolf, and a few patients told me about it so I decided we would give it a try for my boyfriends birthday. One patient had told me that they do not allow you to bring in a birthday cake, unless you spend the extra money and plan an event. I figured this wasn't true.....since every restaurant, amusement park, bowling alley ect. I've ever been to lets you bring in birthday cakes.  The Topgolf website says no outside food or drinks, which I think it completely appropriate EXCEPT FOR BIRTHDAY CAKE/CUPCAKES! I received an email from Topgolfs Senior Events Coordinator Lauren Colvin, confirming that you are not allowed to bring birthday cakes ( I did not email her, what a coincidence the person that responded to my email is the person who books the events). I then called Topgolf again a few days later, and the lady who answered the phone said you can bring in your own birthday cake, if you pay the extra money to plan an event. I'm not sure if anyone has looked at the prices for events but they are expensive......and do not include alcohol. I sent out an Evite over a month ago, informing our friends and family that we are planning on going to TopGolf as walk-in guest and celebrating my boyfriends birthday. Last count there will be over thirty people, who are planning on eating, drinking, and playing golf. So now the dilemma is do I changed the party to somewhere more accommodating for birthdays entirely? Or go there and golf for an hour and then hold the celebration elsewhere where they allow you to actually personalize the birthday experience? This might not bother other people like it does me, but I do believe it is important fact to know before planning on celebrating your birthday at Topgolf.

Super disappointed with my experience here. Servers and food were great- quoted two hours - waited over 3, open bays... lip service on why. Just disappointing when you travel to experience something and it falls far below expectations.

Golfing and food what is there not to love about this place. This is definitely a great place to come and hang out with a group of friends.  The food was your typical like bar food but we had no complaints with the wings and flat bread pizza.  Its just a perfect spot for a Friday night out.

Came here for the first time on Saturday night (3/10/18) with 8 other folks and had a blast.  Here are my quick thoughts on a few things about Top Golf..................

- Be prepared to wait!  2.5 hour wait on a Saturday afternoon (4pm).  Finally got into our bay at about 6:45 or so.  They do text you before your bay is ready, so if you want to go somewhere else and come back, you can.  We just chilled upstairs and played Jenga and chilled the whole time.  The wait is fine if you are with a group, but would be a deal breaker (for me at least) if it was just you and another person on a date or something.  2.5 hours is a LONG TIME to wait for something.

- Incredible service!  Everyone from the bartenders to the front desk, to the managers on duty, to the person assigned to your bay.  Everyone was friendly, helpful and overall in a good mood!

- Food was decent.  We got some chips/salsa/guacamole and some pretzel bites and they were all tasty.  Reasonably priced, too.  I got a Pepsi and it came with free refills all night.

- The Golf.  That's the reason you came here, right?  The golfing part of it was fun.  You can play a slew of different "games" and the computer does the scoring for you.  Purchase a membership card for a one time fee of $5.00.  Otherwise, it doesn't keep score or track your progress.

-  Sensors on the balls seemed a bit "off".  We played a game of "Top Drive" and my one buddy was crushing the shit out of the ball into the intended targets, but it was not registering.  Meanwhile, I can't drive worth a damn, and was hitting maybe 140 yards, and was getting credit for scoring points.  Something was up.  Still fun, but not an accurate scoring system to tell us who actually won.

- If possible, get a bay on the 2nd or 3rd floor.  We got ours on the first floor all the way down at the end (Bay 102) which was a little whack.  All the scoring targets were at an angle, and since you were on the bottom floor, it was hard to judge and sometimes even see the actual target you were aiming at.  It would be much, much better up top looking down.

- Price.  $50.00 an hour on weekends after 5pm.  Seems a bit steep, but when you divide it by your party, it comes out very reasonable.  There were 5 of us that split the cost so for almost 2.5 hours, plus membership, it was only like $30.00 each.  I felt that was very reasonable for the amount of fun we had.  Go during the week and you can get it as low as $25.00 an hour.

Overall, I had a great time.  The wait to get a bay and the sensors (occasionally) were my only complaints.  Good times...so much so, I am coming back sometime this week with my other friends that are coming out for Spring Training.  Can't wait!
The wait was long. They told us 1.5 hrs. But was more like 2.75 hrs. Bar staff was nice, hence the 3 stars

Pretty cool place, I went here for a date night. Be prepared to wait. My friend and I decided not to golf and just visit the restaurant instead. The place was packed! However I stood at the bar and within the five minutes I stood there two bar tenders offered to get me something. So the bar staff seems to have it together as far as customer service. I didn't sit at the bar because within that five minutes a table came open. However the table was dirty and it took about ten minutes to get it cleaned off. (You have to sit yourself and flag someone down to clean the table) After placing my order for food and drinks it did not take long to arrive. Food and drinks were as expected pretty good but can't say the best I ever had. For it to be a place that just opened the staff overall doesn't seem to be to friendly. Also along with the bar they have a restaurant, pool tables and the golf section. They also have a lounge downstairs which is where the pool tables are. They do offer valet parking. Also you will notice police presence both inside and out which mean they have some sort of security in place. Prices are also reasonable. So if you can deal with all the people not a bad place to grab a drink and a bit even if you don't golf!
They definitely have system and booking issues but overall a good time. We paid a reservation fee but couldn't extend after being told we could, then got moved, but they made it right.

If you like hanging out at a bar this is better! The golf is a blast and the prices are reasonable. The food is very good but the service is a bit slow so the food is a bit cold. Still a great time to spend with friends and family!

Lots of fun for everyone- both Golfers and spectators. Huge movie Screens all over the place to view sports. Nicely thought out layout-from restrooms to sitting rooms, bars, swimming pool area and music that was playing-stimulating all senses. Great menu and drink selections and food was visually appealing and tasty! Service was great. Giovanni was outstanding and pleasant-checking on us at appropriate times. 
The golf menu was a little confusing. It needs to define that the rates are based on 6 players / per hour. 
We will definitely recommend to friends and will be back.

I have to let you know right away that I'm not a golfer and have never swung a club except for miniature golf.  While visiting Las Vegas, my friend Brian suggested we go to Top Golf because he had heard of it and wanted to try it because he is the golfer.  
This place is located on Koval Lane, behind the MGM Grand.  If you park in the MGM garage, you will have a very long to golf.  This place has it's own parking lot and valet service.  When you enter, the staff that greets you is very friendly and helpful. The membership fee is only $5 and we signed up for an hour.  Since it was during the afternoon, it cost us $60, but night time will cost $75.  
Each bay is set up with couches, tables so that you can enjoy a drink and/or food while hitting balls. The staff will help you if needed to set up the computer screen so that you compete with others in your party.  Each ball is chipped so that when you hit the ball, the screen will show how far you hit it and will tally your score. Lots of fun for the competitive golfers!!
We didn't try the food as we had just eaten lunch about an hour earlier so I can't comment yet on that, but I did enjoy myself a lot.  It was a fun way to renew friendly competition among old friends.  
To get in the easiest, I would say go during the week and in the afternoon as there were many open bays around us.  I'm guessing if I were a golfer, this rating would be 4 or 5 stars.
Came here for a bday! Lexi, Josh(in the bar) and Anthony have been soo amazing! The food was great we miss the crab cakes, however the 26$ bottle of prosecco is amazing!!

Had a great visit to this location.  We are platinum members in Colorado and stopped by here.  Our host Michelle was very kind and efficient to get us to a bay and playing.  She was very friendly and knowledgable!  Our server Betsy was fantastic also!  Great to talk with, suggested great beers for us to try and very attentive!  Then of course the place and games are a blast!  Food left a bit to be desired, but with Michelle and Betsy you couldn't do better!

First time at Top Golf.  Went for a work event.  Had a blast.  We had two stations reserved and food and drinks catered.  The chicken skewers were awesome!

Even with it being over 110 degrees outside, the misters and fans helped keep it somewhat cool.

Top golf is a fun experience for all skill levels and ages. Really enjoyed our time there. We bought two hours of play and could have kept going. The food was tasty and the service was prompt. I love the experience we all had.

My husband and I were on vacation and came here with friends who live in the area. Such a FUN place!!! This was our first time at any top golf. It was a little confusing when we first got there. There was a greeter who told us to go to the desk to sign up for a membership (5$) but told us only one person was allowed up there at a time. I went up there and told them we were going to get some food first and they told us to just come back after we had food. The food was really good!!! 3 of us had the chicken and waffle sliders! YUMMMMM! We had a craft of mimosas too! Great way to start the morning! Once we got to our bay, we had a server there right away asking us if we wanted drinks. The games were so fun! We had a blast!!

This place is a lot of fun to go to with a group of 6 people. I went for my friend's birthday and she had a party of 12. The line outside to purchase a $5 membership card (needed to play) was super long. Due to the cold weather, one would think the management here would come up with a more effective way to get the line moving. After getting the membership we went to the bar area and got the Pineapple punch golf bag drink ($16). We were told that we couldn't order the drink individually and that there had to be two ppl available to drink it. I think this is just some sort of gimmick to make people think that the drink is very large or very strong. The drink was neither. It was an average sized drink and pretty watered down. And I wasn't impressed by the taste. But you get to take the nice golf bag cup home that lights up... So that's a plus. I also ordered the Kentucky Caramel coffee which is Jim Beam, Kahlúa, caramel sauce, coffee, with whipped cream and 2 donut holes on top. It was underwhelming, but drinkable. The donut holes are really good though.

We went to our bay (which they put both halves of our party side by side b/c there is a 6 person max per bay). The game was super fun even though I wasn't good at it and if you don't have 6 people in your party... I will say that the price is kind of high especially at night. 

I ordered the chili with a side of french fries. The chili was a little bit on the greasy side but it had good flavor. The cornbread that was given on top of the chili had jalapeños and cheese in it, so it had good potential but the only issue was that it wasn't fully cooked. The fries were a disappointment. I would suggest eating before you come to top golf to avoid disappointment. But it was an overall good time.

Minus the long lines to get in we had a great time and would highly recommend.  Just don't get the chicken and waffles.  Frozen chicken as in like the kind you serve to your kids out of the freezer.  Too bad since it was almost $10.  We will be going back for sure.

I have been here numerous times and always have a good time. Kassey was a great server and played along with our shenanigans. I will say I end up spending more than I want, but you  can't argue with having a good time.

I absolutely love this place! They've taken a driving range and turned it into a game that anyone with any skill level can play! It's a little pricey at night but hey, it's a destination place with high tech gadgetry so what do you expect?

Personal tip - go early in the day (before noon) and the bay rates are half price. Of course you loose the "glow bowling" lighting effects on the range but you still get the fun of the game.

A very entertaining place to get your golf swing on. It's a lot of fun even if you don't play regularly or seriously. It is a must-stop place every time I come to Arizona. Staff is awesome and encouraging. They also don't push you to buy more, or upgrade, or seek lessons. That's something any consumer can appreciate. You need to be careful about avoiding peak hours - not only do they get VERY busy, but the price to play can jump up a lot. It's $25 per hour in the mornings, but $50 per hour in the evenings. I think I'll stick to my morning golf routine :)

I'm giving this place a 3 because of how Pricey it is with everything that went wrong. 
We checked in and the wait was understandable.
However we got walked to our area and it still wasn't clean. The people hadn't even left yet.
Then after the nice host walked us through our safety instructions. 
We were 4 shots into it and the computer froze! Wtf
It's no wonder this place is so pricey. It takes forever for every step. 
Cool as shit place and nice employees but zero communication between them to make guest feel it's worth $60 bucks an hour!! 
Top golf better get "on top" of things fast. 
Vegas local

Great for all ages (kids or adults).  Great for golfers or non-golfers.  A fun spot to go with a group of people on a night out.  I have been to Topgolf on numerous occasions and always have a fun time.  On the weekends there tends to be a wait, but it is well worth the wait.  They have a really fun menu to that is served while you play.

Vegas generally sucks for service. This is a clear exception of this phenomenon. I love this place- I don't even like golf and I want to celebrate every birthday of the rest of my life here. Angelica, Andrea, and and Andie were all starssssss. Thank you guys- good sh*t, will be back next year!

One can literally spend an entire day at Top Golf and not know where the day went. This place has everything you can ask for in an entertainment establishment. Great music, good food, full-service bar, big-screen TVs with sports playing on every TV, a swimming pool and golf! This place is a guy's paradise, but can be easily enjoyed by women. This is like a bowling alley on anabolic steroids! 
We came on a Sunday evening for a friend's birthday and put our name in to hit some golf balls. Took about 30 mins to find us a table. During our wait, we decided to take a dip in their pool and order drinks poolside! So dope!
Once you get your table, you get a server who'll bring you drinks and food.They have a variety of games for everyone to enjoy once your at your table. I recommend the "scramble. 
If i had to pick nits, it would be the pricing. It's about $75/hour and you'll have so much fun, it's easy to forget about the time. Our party of eight rang up a $400 tab, but everyone was able to hit some balls and get a full belly and nice buzz. This would be the perfect place to host a fantasy football draft or just spend football sundays. In fact, it's a perfect place to arch any major sporting event. We'll definitely recommend Top Golf to our friends and undoubtedly return to hit some balls! FOOOOUR Stars!!

Great place to take the kids or a nice night out with friends. .. Service is great and so friendly. . We were on the second floor. Our section had its own couch and table... Will definitely be back.. They also play great music, but extremely loud inside. It's hard to have a conversation in the bar area.

In Phoenix with my brothers. One of them had back surgery the day prior. We wanted to get out of the hotel and find something to do and being guys who love golfing it was a no brainer. First time at top golf. Signed in, asked for a bay with a couch so my brother who had surgery could be comfortable while we played. Alex came over set everything up for us, was very patient, friendly and was always around when we need him. He even kept the ice packs my brother needed for his back in a freezer and switched them out as needed. We started with one hour and we were hooked immediately. Before we knew it we had been there for 3.5 hours. The environment, the food and beer were all great. They have found a way to make a driving range fun not just for golfers but for anyone! From now on I am going to be planning more vacations in cities with top golf!!

Every time I come here for dinner, I end up waiting literally 20+ minutes for a waiter/waitress to come over so I can order food. They're all just standing around chatting with each other. Worst. Service. Ever. I'm appalled by how bad it is here.

There is a recurring theme with the service at Topgolf, in that there seems to be a lot of waiting for it. We, like many others, were given a 2 and a half hour wait for a bay to play. No problem, we will just hit the restaurant. 

It took the waitress 15 minutes to acknowledge us, another 15 to get the drinks (minus what we had ordered from the bar a that took 10 minutes on top of that!). 40 minutes to get a beer. 

They need real change to the personnel and work flow if they will be successful beyond the first visit hype around the grand opening. 

And the wings were gross and undercooked, but no one even asked us how they were. 

Good luck, hope your experience is better than mine!
Wonderful experience, very nice choice to spend an evening. We tried just 1 st level, but next night it's going to be some upper 2/3....

This is definitely on my "wish we had in STL" list. Came here to start a guys golf weekend though a little pricier than I expected ($90/hr after 7 pm on Fri), this is Vegas. On a Friday night this place was hopping. We had to wait about 40 minutes for a bay but that was easily passed with watching hockey, dining on chicken wings and drinking beer! The food was actually very good. Although the price was a little on the high-end for pub food. I would recommend the chicken wings. We also tried the crispy rock shrimp which was crispy with an Asian flare. Actually pretty good. 

This place is huge. I predict around 100 bays on different floors. Top floors are more expensive. You rent the bay by the hour similar to a bowling alley. We initially decided to bring our own golf clubs but quickly discovered that the mats were best utilized with topgolf provided clubs. 

There are multiple different games you can play. In essence the goal is to hit each target in order to gain the most points.  You don't need to know how to play golf to have a good time or do well.

Rumor has it that they are opening a top golf in St Louis. I cannot wait for it to open up!  You will likely find me and my friends there on any given night.
25 minuets to check in and a $5 individual card that each person must buy?? We did have fun as a family and that the only reason I didn't give it 1 star. Beers on tap upstairs and friendly staff.

Went there today and there was no parking. Sign in the lot said go to MGM. Sorry Topgolf I am not paying for parking. Really enjoyed myself last time, but as a local, I refuse to play for parking. Good luck convincing the locals to make MGM richer.

Sunday night 930pm, Memorial holiday weekend, 108+ stalls, all taken. Damn!! I love Topgolf's concept, the first time I tried Topgolf was in Virginia in 2010! Loved it!! Vegas is different though.

Fast forward to this past long weekend in Vegas. I had no time to play a full round of 18 with my Vegas buddy, so I decided to take my golf clubs anyways to check out Topgolf Vegas (just opened last week). 1st floor is the cheapest rate, as you go higher, the rates per hour goes up. They have 4 floors but the 4th floor has a pool and is only  used for private groups and parties. You also wait longer as you go higher up the floor. We waited about 30 minutes, Sunday night for the 1st floor. 

I love the concept but it's NOT cheap and will put a nice dent in your wallet. However, if you go with a party of 10 versus a party of 2, you can split the cost amongst your friends. They charge you by the time you spend in the stall. Our bill for my buddy and I with alcohol and 1.5 hours of play was about $140. Ouch. I highly recommend you go with a bigger group. 

As a golfer, you don't really need your own golf clubs (my buddy and I brought our own clubs). Clubs are free to use there for each stall. Waiter service...our waitress Alexis from the Bronx was amazinggggg! She was super attentive and stopped by and chatted with us and her other stalls tons of times. She was well versed in the Topgolf games and recommended what she liked and knew how to run those darn computers for us! A+ Alexis...if you or a Topgolf manager reads this kudos to you! 

Liked the concept, didn't like the wait times (even with stalls open). Pretty expensive unless you bring a bigger group to split the cost. Thanks to Alexis and the two Asian girls from LA in stall 103 Sunday night for entertaining us this past Sunday night! Great times in Vegas! :))

Came here for my birthday definitely wasn't disappointed nice family friendly fun for the whole family we all had a blast skyrocketing balls off of the second floor top golf Las Vegas. The beer that I had was not to help see you it was not too strong it was perfect the Ennis and gone OK aged beer. I also have the opportunity to enjoy a pork belly burger it had peanut butter and jelly on it but interesting combination I will definitely be coming back for more .

Went here for brunch when my parents came into town and it was the perfect place! Friendly staff there to welcome us and explain how it all worked. The food was delicious and the driving range was super fun with all the games. I had never golfed before so this was a great introduction. Hey had an awesome Bloody Mary bar and wide selection of other drinks. We had the breakfast sliders and eggs Benedict, along with the sweet potato tater tots and hash. It was all delicious and the perfect fun atmosphere for us all to have a great time and catch up.

Great concept and it was fun but it could have been more fun if any of the games had been explained to us and if the touch screen had worked properly. We will still return, hope the touch screen works properly (bay host said it was finicky) and ask our bay host about the different games.

Disappointing. We have come here several times and whatever wait they quote you, add 30-45 minutes on and that is when you will get a bay.

Service in the bar was spotty, one guest at our table got his chicken sandwich right away while the rest of the table waited 20 minutes for their food. Drinks would arrive in waves because "no one could find our table" in the bar and server would have to bring them. They also ran out of bloody mary mix at 3 pm on a Saturday.  

Bays are dirty and are not cleaned, other than the tables, in between guests.

They also allow valet service to take up 1/3rd of their lot so if you come past 6 pm on the weekend, be prepared to pay $5 to park

This was my first visit to Topgolf, for a friend's 21st birthday. We didn't make a reservation, but as it was a Tuesday night they weren't very busy and got us a spot right away.
